But hey , the tardy\nMelords&nbsp; who love their vacations like\nschool children ignores this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Common Cause v.\nUnion of India (9th march 2018)&nbsp; the 5 constitutional\nbench while recognizing passive euthanasia, the Supreme Court has allowed\n\u201cadvance directive or living will\u201d,&nbsp; by\nwhich patients can spell out whether treatment can be withdrawn if they fall fall\nterminally ill or are incompetent to express their opinion. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>EUTHANASIA IS A\nPRECONDITION FOR JEWISH MEDICAL INSURANCE COMPANIES ..<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">EUTHANASIA HAS TO BE\nDECIDED BY THE ELECTED LAW MAKERS... NOT SOME COLLEGIUM JUDGES WHOM THE DEEP\nSTATE LOVE ... </b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Laws against euthanasia\nand assisted suicide are in place to prevent abuse and to protect people from\nunscrupulous doctors and others ( GRAB PROPERTY )... <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Legalizing euthanasia\nwould send a clear message: it is better to be dead than sick or disabled...\nThe patient is depressed and believes that his situation is worse than it\nreally is.( OR MADE TO FEEL BY SELFISH RELATIVES )... <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faced with a doctor who\nboth heals and kills, the patient lives with an uncertainty that adds to\nvulnerability... Patients who are ill or dependent often feel worthless and a\nburden to their family and loved ones. .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With legalized assisted\nsuicide, the rate of non-assisted suicide WILL increase... Every patient has\nthe right to refuse treatment or to request that ongoing treatment be\nstopped...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Life in society is based on relationships of\nmutual trust among all citizens. Everyone must be sure that nobody will kill\nhim... . We are already witnessing worrisome abuse in jurisdictions where\neuthanasia or assisted suicide is legal... <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE THE PEOPLE WILL NOT\nALLOW HEALTH INSURANCE TO DECIDE WHO HAS THE RIGHT TO LIVE... RIGHT TO LIVE\nALSO INCLUDES RIGHT TO DIE ?.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TEE HEEEEEEE !.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHERE IS THE\nINTELLIGENCE ?.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">RIGHT TO HEAL ALSO\nINCLUDES RIGHT TO KILL ?.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NO WONDER THE LAWYER\nTURNED JUDGES WERE AT THE BOTTOM OF THE SCHOOL CEREBRAL BARREL.. THE RIGHT TO\nLIFE DOES NOT INCLUDE A RIGHT TO DIE \u2013THIS IS UNIVERSAL\u2026 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The right to life does\nnot create a right to choose death rather than life\u2026 It meant there was no\nright to die at the hands of a third person or with the assistance of a public\nauthority\u2026 The right to life is a moral principle based on the belief that a\nhuman being has the right to live and, in particular, should not be killed by\nANOTHER human being. .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">International law only\nallows law enforcement officers to deliberately take life (\"shooting to\nkill\") where absolutely necessary to defend themselves and others against\nan imminent threat to life. .. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The entitlement of a\nperson to make the decision to end their own life through euthanasia is RIGHT\nTO CHOOSE\u2026. Passive euthanasia is a condition where there is withdrawal of\nmedical treatment with the deliberate intention to hasten the death of a\nterminally-ill patient\u2026 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN A MAN IS SICK ,\nAND IS IN PAIN -- HIS MIND IS VULNERABLE.. GREEDY CHILDEN WILL KILL HIM OFF TO\nGRAB PROPERTY\u2026.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MODI HEALTH CARE WILL\nCAUSE JEW HEALTH INSURANCE COMPANIES TO LAUGH ALL THE WAY TO THE KOSHER BANKS..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHAT IS ARTICLE 141 ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article 141 in The\nConstitution Of India 1949--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">141. Law declared by\nSupreme Court to be binding on all courts The law declared by the Supreme Court\nshall be binding on all courts within the territory of India<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under this provision,\nthe Supreme Court has the power to declare any law and the said declaration has\nthe force of an authoritative precedent, binding on all other courts in India,\nof course except the Supreme Court itself. Such a final authority which the\nSupreme Court claims to possess includes power to decide the validity of a law\nand to interpret it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS GIVES THE ILLEGAL\nCOLLEGIUM JUDICIARY &nbsp;UNBRIDLED\nDISCRETIONARY POWER WITHOUT ANY ACCOUNTABILITY &nbsp;WHATSOEVER.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BUT HEY , DOES THE\nJUDICIARY HAVE THE POWERS TO GO FROM OBJECTIVE TO SUBJECTIVE ? &nbsp;&nbsp;AFTER ALL JUSTICE IS BLIND ! <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In recent years, one\nhas come across several judgments of the Supreme Court wherein it has been\nforaying into areas which had long been forbidden to the judiciary by reason of\nthe doctrine of \u2018separation of powers\u2019, which is part of the basic structure of\nthe Constitution.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unfortunately, these judgments have created an uncertainty\nabout the discretion vested in the court to invoke Article 142 where even\nfundamental rights of individuals are being ignored. What we have found is that\nthe court, in its anxiety to do justice in a particular case or matter, has\nfailed to account for the far-reaching effects of its judgments, which may\nresult in the deprivation of the rights of a multitude of individuals who are\nnot before the court at that time.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the notification\nby the central government prohibited liquor stores along National Highways only\n\u2014 those abutting the National Highways \u2014 the Supreme Court put in place a ban\nof a distance of 500 metres by invoking Article 142.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Additionally, and in the\nabsence of any similar notification by any of the State governments, the court\nextended the ban to State highways as well. As a result of the order, thousands\nof hotels, restaurants, bars and liquor stores were forced to close down or\ndiscontinue the sale of liquor, resulting in lakhs of employees being thrown\nout of employment.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It may be noted that the total percentage of accidental\ndeaths caused due to drunken driving, as found by the court from the statistics\nof 2015, was only 4.2% as against the 44.2% caused by over-speeding.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A BIG PERCENTAGE OF\nACCIDENTS ARE DUE TO HYPOGLYCEMIA BLACKOUTS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/03/hypoglycemia-low-blood-sugar-and-road.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/03/hypoglycemia-low-blood-sugar-and-road.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The Supreme Court had\nitself held that the right to employment is a basic right traceable to Article\n21.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">However, in its order banning the sale of alcohol along highways, the\nMelords playing GOD made no reference to the loss of employment to lakhs of\npeople, a direct consequence of the order.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">There is a thin line\nvariation between judicial activism and judicial overreach.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">The time has come for\nthe Supreme Court to introspect on whether the use of Article 142 as an\nindependent source of power should be regulated by strict guidelines\u2014if the\nMelords DRUNK WITH POWER do not then the govt must strike it down with an ordinance</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\">WE THE PEOPLE WARN THE\nELECTED EXECUTIVE\u2014JUDICIAL REVIEW IS AN UNDEMOCRATIC SYSTEM AND IT IS DANGEROUS\nTO THE WATAN WHEN JUDGES ARE CONTROLLED BY THE DEEP STATE..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\">THE KOSHER DEEP STATE\nWAS THRILLED WHEN INDIA REGULARISED HOMOSEXUALITY AND ADULTERY..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 200%;\">JUDICIAL REVIEW\nEMPOWERS THE ILLEGAL COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY TO DECIDE THE FATE OF LAWS PASSED BY\nTHE ELECTED AND ACCOUNTABLE LEGISTLATURE WHICH REPRESENTS THE SOVEREIGN WILL OF\nTHE PEOPLE.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan;\">WE THE PEOPLE ARE ABOVE\nTHE CONSTITUTION.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A bench (3 or 5 or 9\njudges) of the Supreme Court hears a judicial review case. It gives a decision\nby a simple majority. Very often, the fate of a law is determined by the\nmajority of a single judge. In this way a single judge\u2019s reasoning can\ndetermine the fate of a law which had been passed by a MASSIVE majority of the\nelected representatives of the sovereign people.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">National Judicial\nAppointments Commission (NJAC) was a proposed body which would have been\nresponsible for the appointment and transfer of judges to the higher judiciary\nin India.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Commission was established by amending the Constitution of India\nthrough the ninety-ninth constitution amendment with the Constitution\n(Ninety-Ninth Amendment) Act, 2014 or 99th Constitutional Amendment Act-2014\npassed by the Lok Sabha on 13 August 2014 and by the Rajya Sabha on 14 August\n2014.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The NJAC would have replaced the collegium\nsystem for the appointment of judges as invoked by the Supreme court via\njudicial fiat by a new system. Along with the Constitution Amendment Act, the\nNational Judicial Appointments Commission Act, 2014, was also passed by the\nParliament of India to regulate the functions of the National Judicial Appointments\nCommission.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The NJAC Bill and the\nConstitutional Amendment Bill, was ratified by 16 of the state legislatures in\nIndia, and subsequently assented by the President of India Pranab Mukherjee on\n31 December 2014.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The NJAC Act and the Constitutional Amendment Act came into\nforce from 13 April 2015.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 16 October 2015, the\nConstitution Bench of Supreme Court upheld the collegium system and struck down\nthe NJAC as unconstitutional .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">AN ILLEGAL COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY DID THIS TO\nBHARATMATA.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY WHERE JUDGES ELECT JUDGES\nIS NOT ALLOWED BY THE CONSTITUTION<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">INDIA IS THE ONLY NATION ON THE PLANET WHERE\nJUDGES ELECT JUDGES \u2013 IN THE CASE OF INDIA, THE DEEP STATE IS INVOLVED IN\nSELECTING JUDGES ( LIKE LIKE JNU COMMIE PROFESSORS )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">WE ALL KNOW THAT THE RBI GOVERNOR IS SELECTED PERSONALLY BY JEW ROTHSCHILD..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>The Supreme Court is\nitself bound by the Constitution of India and the Parliament can amend the\nConstitution any time they want..&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><span style=\"font-size: 16pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">India has the longest\nwritten constitution of any independent nation in the world, containing 395\narticles and 12 schedules, as well as numerous amendments, for a total of\n117,369 words in the English language version<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Article 368, does not\ncontain any limitation on the power of Parliament to amend any part of the\nConstitution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Article 368 &nbsp;empowers the Parliament to amend the\nconstitution without any exception and it is the exercise of sovereign\nconstituent power.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Constitution not\nonly defines the powers of each organ, but also demarcates their\nresponsibilities. It regulates the relationship between the different organs\nand between the government and the people. The preamble says WE THE PEOPLE are\nabove the constitution\u2014this means constitution cannot be used to strait jacket\nthe entire population of the nation.. Less than 0.1% of Indians &nbsp;( all homosexuals ) would approve of adultery\nbeing legal- yet 5 illegal collegium judges lumped adultery down 1300 million\nIndians.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">A Constitution should\nbe a dynamic document. It should be able to adapt itself to the changing needs\nof the society. Sometimes under the impact of new powerful social and economic\nforces, the pattern of government will require major changes. Keeping this\nfactor in mind the Draftsmen of the Indian Constitution incorporated Article\n368 in the Constitution which dealt with the procedure of amendment. Due to\nArticle 368 the Indian Constitution cannot be called RIGID.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Articles of the Indian\nConstitution can be amended by a simple majority in the Parliament (Second\nSchedule, Article 100(3), 105, 11, 124, 135, 81, 137), or by special majority\nthat is majority of the total membership of each house and by majority of not\nless than two thirds of the members of each house present and voting , or by\nRatification by the State Legislatures after special majority (Article 73, 162,\nChapter 1V of Part V, Chapter V of Part V1, Seventh Schedule, representation of\nthe State in Parliament and provisions dealing with amendment of the\nConstitution).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Constituent power is\ntermed as a power which is exercised by a representative body authorized by a\nConstitution to amend the Constitution. This amending power is one of the most\ndesirable powers in a Constitution, if a Constitution as a fundamental document\nis to continue. We are now in the DIGITAL age.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Article 368 (1) of the\nConstitution of India grants constituent power to make formal amendments and\nempowers Parliament to amend the Constitution by way of addition, variation or\nrepeal of any provision according to the procedure laid down therein, which is\ndifferent from the procedure for ordinary legislation. Article 368 has been\namended by the 24th and 42nd Amendments in 1971 and 1976 respectively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Article\n368 in The Constitution Of India 1949<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">368. Power of\nParliament to amend the Constitution and procedure therefor<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) Notwithstanding\nanything in this Constitution, Parliament may in exercise of its constituent\npower amend by way of addition, variation or repeal any provision of this\nConstitution in accordance with the procedure laid down in this article<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) An amendment of\nthis Constitution may be initiated only by the introduction of a Bill for the\npurpose in either House of Parliament, and when the Bill is passed in each\nHouse by a majority of the total membership of that House present and voting,\nit shall be presented to the President who shall give his assent to the Bill\nand thereupon the Constitution shall stand amended in accordance with the terms\nof the Bill: Provided that if such amendment seeks to make any change in<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(a) Article 54, Article\n55, Article 73, Article 162 or Article 241, or<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(b) Chapter IV of Part\nV, Chapter V of Part VI, or Chapter I of Part XI, or<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(c) any of the Lists in\nthe Seventh Schedule, or<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(d) the representation\nof States in Parliament, or<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(e) the provisions of\nthis article, the amendment shall also require to be ratified by the\nLegislature of not less than one half of the States by resolution to that\neffect passed by those Legislatures before the Bill making provision for such\namendment is presented to the President for assent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3) Nothing in Article\n13 shall apply to any amendment made under this article<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(4) No amendment of\nthis Constitution (including the provisions of Part III) made or purporting to\nhave been made under this article whether before or after the commencement of\nSection 55 of the Constitution (Forty second Amendment) Act, 1976 shall be\ncalled in question in any court on any ground<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(5) For the removal of\ndoubts, it is hereby declared that there shall be no limitation whatever on the\nconstituent power of Parliament to amend by way of addition, variation or\nrepeal the provisions of this Constitution under this article PART XXI\nTEMPORARY, TRANSITIONAL AND SPECIAL PROVISIONS</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Supreme court ruled\nthat the constituent power under article 368 must be exercised by the\nParliament in the prescribed manner and can not be exercised under the legislative\npowers of the Parliament\u2014which is nonsense !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In India all\nconstitutional amendments can be generally effectuated by a Special Majority,\ni.e., it must be passed by both the houses, with more than 50% of total number\nof members along with two thirds of members present and voting.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The clause 2 of Art 368\nalso specifies certain situations in which apart from above mentioned special\nmajority ratification by more than half of the number of States is required,\nthey are:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Election of the President.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Extent of executive\npower of the Union and State.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Provisions dealing\nwith the Supreme Court.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Provisions dealing\nwith High Courts in the States and Union territories<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Distribution of\nlegislative power between Centre and State<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Representation of\nStates in Parliament.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Seventh schedule<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"># Art. 368 itself.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The Twenty-fourth Amendment made changes to\narticles 13 and 368 in 1971:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(i) A new clause was\nadded to article 13: \"(4) Nothing in this article shall apply to any\namendment of this Constitution made under article 368.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(ii) Amendments were\nmade to article 368:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a) The article was\ngiven a new marginal heading: \"Power of Parliament to amend the\nConstitution and procedure therefore.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b) A new clause was\nadded as clause (I): \"(I) Notwithstanding anything in this Constitution,\nParliament may in exercise of its constituent power amend by way of addition,\nvariation or repeal any provision of this Constitution in accordance with the\nprocedure laid down in this article.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">c) Another clause was\nadded as clause (3): \"(3) Nothing in article 13 shall apply to any\namendment under this article.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Another amendment to\nthe old article 368 (now article 368(2)) made it obligatory rather than\ndiscretionary for the President to give his assent to any Bill duly passed\nunder the article.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>Kesavananda Bharti v.\nState of Kerala: </b>It is a landmark of the Supreme Court of India, and is the\nbasis in Indian law for the exercise by the Indian judiciary of the power to\njudicially review, and strike down, amendments to the Constitution of India\npassed by the Indian Parliament which conflict with or seek to alter the\nConstitution's basic structure. The judgment also defined the extent to which\nthe Indian Parliament could restrict the right to property, in pursuit of land\nreform and the redistribution of large landholdings to cultivators, overruling\nprevious decisions that suggested that the right to property could not be\nrestricted. Clauses (4) and (5) inserted in Art. 368 by the 42nd Amendment Act\nare invalid because they take away the right of judicial review. Parliament\ncannot increase its amending power by amending Art. 368. The courts enlarged\ntheir powers by inventing implied limitations\u2026 Without uncontrolled power the\nParliament cannot bring about socio-economic reforms.&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;\">WE\nTHE PEOPLE DECLARE THIS NULL AND VOID.. THE ILLEGAL COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY DOES\nNOT HAVE THE&nbsp; POWERS ..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;INDIA IS THE ONLY NATION ON THE PLANET WITH A\nCOLLEGIUM JUDICIARY WHERE JUDGES ELECT JUDGES.. OUR CONSTITUTION DOES NOT ALLOW\nTHIS GOONDA NAY MAFIA COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY.. WE WANT ELECTED REPRESENTAYIVES TO\nDELIVER DHARMA ( NOT DEEP STATE CONTROLLED A COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY ).. WE DON\u2019T WANT\nILLEGAL COLEGIUM JUDICARY TO SAVE THE WATAN.. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">NOW WE EVEN HAVE THE\nLUMP THE MORBID NEWS FROM RAGHURA RAJAN THAT RB GOVERNOR CAN DEFY THE FINANCE\nMINISTER\u2014OH YEAH ROTHSCHILD AGENT AND DEEP STATE DARKING RAGHURAM RAJAN ?&nbsp; WE KNOW HOW YOUR FATHER WAS SCREWED FOR HIS\nACTIVITIES.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">In either of the two\nprocedures after the bill is passed it is reserved for Presidential assent,\nwhich in turn is bound to give it. In India the procedure has proved to be far\nmore flexible, till now as much as 101 amendments have been made.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The social, economic\nand political conditions of the people go on changing so the constitutional law\nof the country must also change in order toward it to the changing needs,\nchanging life of the people. If no provisions were made for amendment of the\nconstitution, the people would have recourse to extra constitutional method\nlike revolution to change the constitution..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">The framers of the\nIndian constitution were anxious to have a document which could grow with a\ngrowing nation, adapt itself to the changing circumstances of a growing people.\nThe Constitution has to be changed at every interval of time. Nobody can say\nthat this is the finality. A constitution which is static is a constitution\nwhich ultimately becomes a big hurdle in the path of the progress of the\nnation. The COLLEGIUM Melords don\u2019t have the brains to understand this.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">According to\nconstitution, parliament and state legislature in India have the power to make\nthe laws within their respective jurisdiction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. CHANDRABABU AND MOMOTO..<br />\n<br />\nAS PER WIKIPEDIA THE PRESIDENT AND STATE GOVERNOR ARE MERE RUBBERS STAMPS. .<br />\n<br />\nSORRY , BOTH PRESIDENT AND GOVERNOR HAVE ENORMOUS SUBJECTIVE DISCRETIONARY POWERS..<br />\n<br />\nSection 6 of the Delhi Special Police Establishment Act, 1946 states:-<br />\n<br />\n\u201cConsent of State Government to exercise of powers and jurisdiction \u2013 Nothing contained in section 5 shall be deemed to enable any member of the Delhi Special Police Establishment to exercise powers and jurisdiction in any area in a State, not being a Union territory or railway area], without the consent of the Government of that State.\u201d</div>\n<div style=\"font-size: 16px;\">\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">IF CHANDRABABU NAIDU OR MAMATA BANNERJEE IS GUILT OF EMBEZZLEMENT OR BRIBERY CBI WILL MAKE THEM EAT CROW..&nbsp;</span></b></div>\n<br />\nCBI CAN EVEN ARREST ANY SENIOR ARMY OFFICERS ON CHARGES OF CORRUPTION..<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">CBI DOES NOT INTERFERE IN STATE AFFAIRS --THE MAIN REASON BEING DUPLICATION OF WORK..</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The inadequacy of the state police to deal with CORRUPTION of CM and his ministers is apparent. THE SUPREME COURT HAS NO POWERS TO HARNESS THE CBI..&nbsp;</b></div>\n<br />\nCBI CAN INVESTIGATE ANY CENTRAL GOVT OFFICE IN ANY STATE.<br />\n<br />\nCBI CAN INVESTIGATE ANY CASE IN THE STATE WHERE FINANCIAL INTERESTS OF THE CENTRAL GOVT IS INVOLVED.<br />\n<br />\nCBI CAN INVESTIGATE ANY CASE IN THE STATE RELATING TO BREACH OF CENTRAL LAWS.. ( GHEE SACRIFICE )..<br />\n<br />\nIT IS NOT THE MALE HUSBAND OR SON ALONE THAT BENEFITS FROM THE PILGRIMAGE ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WIFE FILLS UP A COCONUT WITH DESI GHEE ( USING THE MIDDLE EYE OF THE COCONUT ) IN FRONT OF THE AYYAPPA IDOL OR PICTURE OF HER HOME BESIDE A LIT LAMP..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS GHEE FILLED COCONUT IS CARRIED INSIDE THE IRUMUDI KETTU ON THE HEAD OF THE MALE PILGRIM..<br />\n<br />\nHE WILL NOT ALLOW THE IRUMUDI KETU TO TOUCH THE GROUND TILL HE CLIMBS UP THE 18 STEPS\u2026<br />\n<br />\nTHE KERALA POLICE IS DOING BLASPHEMY BY ORDERING THE PILGRIM TO OPEN THE IDRUMUDI KETTU , AS IF THERE IS A TIME BOMB INSIDE.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS GHEE IS POURED ON THE AYYAPPA IDOL INSIDE THE SANNIDHANAM.. TIMING WINDOW IS FROM 0330 AM TO 7 AM AND THEN 0830 TO 1100 AM..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS GHEE IS GIVEN BACK AS PRASADMA AND THE PILGRIM GOES BACK HOME WITH THIS GHEE FOR HIS WIFE ( OR MOTHER WHO FILLED THE COCONUT ) TO CONSUME ..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS EQUIVALENT TO THE MENSTRAUTING WOMAN UNDERTAKING THE PILGRIMAGE HERSELF..<br />\n<br />\nAS THE MALE PILGRIMS WALKS TOWARDS SABARIMALA UNDER A GURUSAMI , THEY CHANT JOYOUSLY \u201c NEY ABHISHEKAM SWAMIKKE \u201c ..<br />\n<br />\nNEY ABHISHKAM HAS PUJA TIMINGS AT DAWN ..<br />\n<br />\nIF THE PILGRIMS IS FORCED BACK BY THE KERALA POLICE ON COMMIE PINARAYI VIJAYANs ORDERS , HE CANNOT DO THE NEY ABHISHEKAM.. THE SPINE OF THIS SOLEMN ENDEAVOUR IS BROKEN..<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nFor those pilgrims who have not observed the purity ( say he masturbated ) during his trek to Sabarimala , he will not take back the ghee he brought inside the coconut, there is a container called Neythoni (Ghee Canoe) into which they pour out the ghee. He goes back home empty handed sans prasadham..<br />\n<br />\nThe wife understands as the ghee would hurt her..<br />\n<br />\nThis pilgrimage is then not considered to be ACCOMPLISHED.<br />\n<br />\nIf later he has to become a guruswamy, he has to count how many ties he took the ghee prasadam back home to the woman who filled it..<br />\n<br />\nIt has to be 18 times..<br />\n<br />\nThere is no fooling anybody here , including yourself..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS RITUAL HAS GONE ON FOR 5900 YEARS..<br />\n<br />\nNOW WE HAVE AN ATHEIST COMMIE CM NAMED PINARAYI VIJAYAN WHO HAS UNLEASHED A STALIN TYPE REIGN OF TERRROR ..<br />\n<br />\nHE HAS SELF DESTRUCTED..<br />\n<br />\nHE IS BEYOND CARE !<br />\n<br />\nCOMMUNIST PARTY IS DEAD \u2013THE LAST BASTION OF KERALA HAS CRUMBLED, DUE TO ONE MANs GOONDAGIRI..<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_10BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; SOME SMALL CHILDREN FAINTED DUE TO LACK OF DRINKING WATER .. PILGRIMS COULD NOT ANSWER THE CALL OF NATURE.. WHAT IS ALL THIS ?<br />\n<br />\nDEVAWAOM BOARD HAS BECOME RICH WITH POOR PILGRIMs MONEY.. It is stress busting time.<br />\n<br />\nThe government does NOT arrest people who had Marijuana or Cannabis ( Bhang ) as long as they are not disruptive. Enemies have heart to heart talks and make up on this day.<br />\n<br />\nThe atmosphere is electric with fun and joy. THIS BOARD HAS BEEN IN THE CONTROL OF ANTI-HINDU FORCES FROM ABROAD FOR A LONG TIME..<br />\n<br />\nTHE DEVASWOM BOARD ARE ENEMIES OF SANATANA DHARMA AND HINDU DEVOTEES.. THE BENAMI MEDIA, THE COLLEGIUM JUDICARY AND CONTINIOUS ROTATION OF CHRISTIAN/ MUSLIM/ COMMIE GOVTS IN KERALA SUPPORT THE ANTI-HINDU FOREIGN FORCES..<br />\n<br />\nTHE LAST DEVASWOM BOARD PRESIDENT TOLD THE PEOPLE ON JANAM TV THAT HE HANDED OVER 1200 CRORES TO HIS RELEIVER, BUT STILL SABARIMALA PILGRIMS ARE BEING DENIED OF THEIR FUNDNAMENTAL RIGHTS OF DRINKING WATER , TOILET FACILITIES AND RIGHT TO WORSHIP.<br />\n<br />\nTHE DEVASWOM BOARD IS PACKED WITH ATHEIST COMMIES AND CHRISTIANS WITH HINDU NAMES.. ALL THEY ARE BOTHERED IS ABOUT THEMSELVES, THEIR SALARIES, THEIR BONUSES ,AND THEIR PERKS..<br />\n<br />\nTheir aim of Devaswom board is to manage Hindu temples and their assets and to ensure their smooth operation in accordance with traditional rituals and customs \u2013but in reality this board does just the opposite..<br />\n<br />\nThe five Kerala devaswoms (Guruvayur, Travancore, Malabar, Cochin, and Koodalmanikyam) together manage nearly 3045 temples.<br />\n<br />\nPeople of other religions and atheist commies have no right to run Hindu temples and pilgrimages. The Kerala government, in order to project themselves as the flag bearer of secularism, is playing with the religious sentiments of the Hindus with benami media and collegium judiciary in cahoots.<br />\n<br />\nThis is part of a concerted effort of the state to take over Hindu temples.. Travancore Devaswom Board chief A Padma Kumar is also a CPM leader.<br />\n<br />\nNow the main aim of the Devaswom board if to make the Hindu self loathing and also grab the enormous PRISTINE gold in the vaults of Padmanabhaswamy temple.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/01/mansa-musa-king-of-mali-and-sri.html<br />\n<br />\nA PRIME EXAMPLE OF ANTI-HINDU , ANTI-WATAN DEVASWOM BOARD CONSPIRACY IS AFFAIRS OF THE KODUNGALLUR TEMPLE BELOW\u2014<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html<br />\n<br />\nIN THE CURRENT SABRIMALA MENSTRUATING AGE WOMENs ISSUE THE DROHI DEVASWOM BOARD IS HELL BENT OF PUSHING WOMEN OF THE MENSTRUATING AGE INTO SABARIMALA PILGRIMAGE THOUGH THEY KNOW THAT 99.9% ( A REFERENDUM CAN PROVE THIS ) OF HINDU WOMEN WANT TO WAIT TILL THE AGE OF 50..<br />\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/judiciary-in-contempt-of-we-people-capt.html<br />\n<br />\nWE THE PEOPLE KNOW THE DEEP STATE PAYROLL ANTI-HINDU JUDGES IN OUR SYSTEM..<br />\n<br />\nFIVE JUDGES OF AN ILLEGAL COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY WHICH IS NOT ALLOWED BY THE CONSTITUTION WANT TO DECIDE THE FATE OF 1300 MILLION INDIANS?..<br />\nSORRY, WE THE PEOPLE WONT ALLOW THAT..<br />\n<br />\nThey anti-Hindu Devaswom board controls the religious rituals carried out in temples, decide who will be appointed as the chief Pujari of the temple, manage their finances and even tax the income of Hindu temples.<br />\n<br />\nOnly Hindu temples are subjected to interventions, places of worship of other religion such as churches and mosques are free from any government intervention.<br />\n<br />\nCOMMUNISTS GRABBED MOST OF THE TEMPLE LANDS AND DISTRIBUTED IT AMONG LANDLESS COMMIE CADRE AND CHRISTIAN CONVERTS.. IN DUE COURSE ALL THESE PIECEMEAL PLOTS OF LAND WERE BOUGHT BACK BY LAND SHARKS CONTROLLED BY THE POLITICIANS AND CHURCH.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..<br />\n<br />\nCapt. KNOW WHO YOU ARE ..</div>\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">THE DANAVA CIVILIZATION OF KERALA PRECEDED THE VEDIC CIVILIZATION BY SEVERAL MILLINIUMS..</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\nTHIS TRUE HISTORY HAS BEEN SUNK BY THE WHITE MAN WHO DID NOT WANT THE GLORY OF EGYPTIAN CIVILIZATION TO BE OWNED BY KERALA..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/land-of-punt-ophir-and-sheba-is-north.html</span><br />\n<br />\nWE SEE THE FAMILIAR KATHAKALI DUO OF A MAN IN ELABORATE HEADGEAR AND A WOMAN IN A CAPE.. WHO ARE THEY ?<br />\n<br />\nTHEY ARE DANAVA KING HIRANYAKASHIPU AND HIS SISTER HOLIKA WEARING THE MAGICAL FIRE PROTECTION CAPE..<br />\n<br />\nHOLIKA WAS KILLED , THIS IS WHY KERALA DOES NOT CELEBRATE HOLI..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">VISHNUs FOURTH AVATAR NARASIMHA</span></b>&nbsp;CAME TO KILL DANAVA KING HIRANYAKASHIPU ....<br />\n<br />\nKERALA KING MAHABALIs FATHER EMPEROR VIROCHANA RULED THE WHOLE PLANET..<br />\n<br />\nDANAVA KING MAHABALIs GREAT GRANDFATHER WAS HIRANYAKASHIPU ( VIJAYA , VISHNUs BELOVED GATE KEEPER ) .. .<br />\n<br />\nSAGE SHUKRACHARYA THE MENTOR OF KING MAHABALI ASKED HIM TO DO THE ASHWAMEDHA YAGNA ..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS NOT A BLOODY HORSE SACRIFICE BUT A \u201cVOTE OF CONFIDENCE\u201d WHICH MAKE A KING AN EMPEROR.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/09/ashwamedha-yagam-bloodless-sacrifice.html</span><br />\n<br />\nKING MAHABALI CONDUCTED THE ASHWAMEDHA YAGNA AND DECLARED HIMSELF EMPEROR ANGERING THE DEVAS WHO THEN REQUESTED VISHNU TO COME AS FIFTH AVATAR VAMANA ( BLUE FACED BRAHMIN MIDGET ) AND BANISH EMPEROR MAHABALI TO PATALA ( PERU )..<br />\n<br />\nTHE DEVAS WERE UNNERVED BY THE \u201c&nbsp;<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">SHARANAM&nbsp;</span></b>\u201c ( PROTECTION ) PROVIDED BY EMPEROR MAHABALI TO VASSAL KINGS WHO SHIFTED ALLEGIANCE TO THE POWERFUL AND PROSPEROUS DANAVA CAMP..<br />\n<br />\nFESTIVALS CONTINUE AS A BLOODLINE DON\u2019T LIE.. KERALA DOES NOT CELEBRATE DIWALI.. WE WERE AT THE RECEIVING END , THAT IS WHY..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/09/why-kerala-does-not-celebrate-diwali-or.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTHE MAYAN / AZTEC/ INCA CIVILIZATION IS DANAVA..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/07/maya-inca-aztec-civilizations-decoded.html</span><br />\n<br />\nTHE EGYPTIAN CIVILIZATION IS DANAVA..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/10/eight-sided-pyramid-of-giza-egypt.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">AYYAPPA WAS THE NINTH AVATAR OF VISHNU..<br /><br />HE DISAPPEARED FROM KERALA AS A SMALL CHILD AND RESURFACED IN EGYPT AS IMHOTEP, THE GOD FROM THE EAST , WHO WAS MORE POWERFUL THAN THE PHARAOH..&nbsp;</span></b><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/08/imhotep-patron-saint-of-freemasons-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\nWHEN THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA THERE WAS NOT A SINGLE BUDDHIST LEFT IN INDIA.. BUDDHISM DID NOT APPEAL TO INDIANS AS BUDDHA ATE PIG AND DID NOT BELIEVE IN THE SOUL..<br />\n<br />\n<b style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><span style=\"color: magenta;\">JEW ROTHSCHILD REMOVED AYYAPPA AS THE NINTH AVATAR OF VISHNU AND INSERTED BUDDHA TO REVIVE BUDDHISM AND \u201cDIVIDE AND RULE \u201c..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nASHOKA WHO CONVERTED FROM BAAAAAD HINDUSIM TO GOOOOOD BUDDHISM NEVER EXISTED.. BUT HEY, THE HUMAN DNA MEMORY MADE SURE THAT TODAY MORE PEOPLE FROM THESE STATES COME FOR SABARIMALA PILGRIMAGE THAN MALAYALIS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE FAKE UDIPI MUTT WAS AN AYYAPPA TEMPLE..
