Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/we-people-declare-that-all-laws-created.html?showComment=1540965247372#c469444105037312664\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">October 31, 2018 at 11:24 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_7MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/we-people-declare-that-all-laws-created.html<br />\n<br />\nPARAMOUNT CLAUSE : WE THE PEOPLE ARE ABOVE THE CONSTITUTION.. THE CONSTITUTION CANNOT BE USED TO STRAIT-JACKET \"WE THE PEOPLE\"\u2026.<br />\n<br />\nRECENTLY THE COLLEGIUM JUDICIARY PASSED THREE LAWS BELOW--<br />\nAAA- ADULTERY IS LEGAL..<br />\nBBB- HOMOSEXUALITY IS LEGAL..<br />\nCCC- MENSTRUATING WOMEN CAN ENTER SABARIMALA SANNIDHANAM\u2026<br />\n<br />\nTHE UNELECTED / UNACCOUNTABLE JUDICIARY CANNOT MAKE OR BREAK LAWS.. ALL THEY ARE ALLOWED TO DO IS TO INTERPRET EXISTING LAWS \u2026.<br />\n<br />\nIN OUR CASE THE JUDICIARY IS A COLLEGIUM SYSTEM\u2014WHICH MEANS JUDGES ELECT JUDGES.. THIS IS NOT ALLOWED BY OUR CONSTITUTION. \u2026<br />\n<br />\nINDIA IS THE ONLY NATION ON THE PLANET WHERE JUDGES ELECT JUDGES .. THIS BREEDS NEPOTISM AND TRAITORS IN DEEP STATE PAYROLL\u2026.<br />\n<br />\nJUDGES CAN ONLY JUDGE FOR A SPECIFIC CASE FOR AN AGGRIEVED INDIVIDUAL OR SMALL GROUP OF LIMITED NUMBERS \u2026 FOR AN AGGRIEVED NATION OF 1300 MILLION PEOPLE WE HAVE AN ELECTED DEMOCRATIC SYSTEM..<br />\n<br />\nLAWYER TURNED JUDGES WHO CANNOT THINK BEYOND THE OBJECTIVE, ARE THE BANE OF INDIAN JUDICIAL SYSTEM\u2026<br />\n<br />\nDHARMA ( NATURAL JUSTICE ) CAN NEVER BE OBJECTIVE AND GIVEN TO A NON-CONSCIOUS CALCULATOR / COMPUTER , WHICH CAN NEVER TELL THE MORAL OF A STORY , LAUGH AT A SUBTLE JOKE OR UNDERSTAND WHAT IS CULTURE..<br />\n<br />\nWE NEED A SYSTEM WHERE INTELLIGENT JUDGES ( WHO HAVE THE CEREBRAL WHEREWITHAL TO GLEAN CIRCUMSTANTIAL EVIDENCE) ARE SELECTED BY A NATION WIDE ENTRANCE EXAM LIKE IIT...<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nPUT ABOVE CRITICAL COMMENT IN WEBSITES OF--<br />\nCJI GOGOI<br />\nALL SUPREME COURT JUDGES<br />\nALL SUPREME COURT LAWYERS<br />\nATTORNEY GENERAL<br />\nLAW TO BE FAIR TO HIM HE MAY BE SUFFERING FROM SIDE EFFECTS OF MEDICINES HE MAY BE CONSUMING AFTER HIS MEDICAL TRIP TO USA..<br />\n<br />\nTHERE HAS BEEN EXTREME VIOLATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS AT SABARIMALA.. THERE IS A CONSPIRACY TO KILL THE 5900 YEAR OLD PILGRIMAGE..<br />\n<br />\nPILGRIMS WERE NOT ALLOWED TO WALK FROM NILAKKAL TO PAMPA ON 5TH NOV 2018 MORNING 1115 AM ..AS VEHICLES WERE NOT ALLOWED INCLUDING KSRTC BUSES ..<br />\n<br />\nAFTER 11I5 HRS THOSE WILLING TO WALK THE UPHILL 23 KM ROUTE FROM NILAKKAL TO PAMPA WERE ALLOWED TO WALK..<br />\n<br />\nIT WAS MORALE CRUSHING TO SEE OLD CRIPPLES HOPPING UP THE ROUTE AND WOMEN WITH CRYING CHILDREN.. MIND YOU SOME HAVE COME AS FAR AWAY AS TELENGANA..<br />\n<br />\nTHE DEVASWOM BOARD CUT OF DRINKING WATER, SANITARY WATER, ELECTRICITY AND LOCKED ALL TOILETS ON 5TH NOV 2018 EVENING ONWARDS .. SOME SMALL CHILDREN FAINTED DUE TO LACK OF DRINKING WATER .. PILGRIMS COULD NOT ANSWER THE CALL OF NATURE.. WHAT IS ALL THIS ?<br />\n<br />\nDEVAWAOM BOARD HAS BECOME RICH WITH POOR PILGRIMs MONEY.. THIS BOARD IS PACKED WITH ATHEIST COMMIES AND CHRISTIANS WITH HINDU NAMES..<br />\n<br />\nARREST THE PRESIDENT OF THE DEWASWOM BOARD PRESIDENT PADMAKUMAR AND DEWASOM BOARD MINISTER KADAKAMPALLI SURENDRAN.. KEEP THEM IN JAIL WITHOUT BAIL..<br />\n<br />\nNEY ABHISKEKHAM WAS NOT ALLOWED , AND SOME PILGRIMS FROM OTHER STATE WENT BACK DISAPPOINTED BREAKING THE SPINE OF THE PILGRIMAGE ..<br />\n<br />\nLATER WHEN THE TOKEN COUNTERS OPENED THE DEWASWOM BOARD INCREASED CHARGES FROM RUPEES 10 TO 20 --WITH THE LAME EXCUSE THAT THERE ARE NO TICKETS..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WHOLE IDEA IS TO SEND PILGRIMS BACK AND KILL THE 5900 YEAR OLD PILGRIMAGE..<br />\n<br />\nWE ASK THE GOVERNOR OF KERALA TO MAKE IMMEDIATE ACTION ..<br />\n<br />\nWE ASK THE HOME MINISTER TO ARRAIGN THE DGP OF POLICE BEHERA AND ADVISOR TO PINARAYI VIJAYAN EX-DGP RAMAN SRIVASTAVA..<br />\n<br />\nWE THE PEOPLE DEMAND A PROPER INQUIRY FOR ATROCITIES AGAINST WOMEN AND CHILD PILGRIMS. TILL THEY CLEAR THIS INQUIRY STOP THEIR SALARIES AND RETIREMENT PERKS..<br />\n<br />\nIS INDIA A DEMOCRACY?<br />\n<br />\nWHY IS THE IPS POLICE PERSONALLY LOYAL TO THE CM OF KERALA.. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/11/the-indian-constitution-does-not-allow.html?showComment=1541402414156#c3218814970497086894\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">November 5, 2018 at 12:50 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_10MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nMOST IMPORTANT COMMENT:<br />\nMOST IMPORTANT COMMENT:<br />\nMOST IMPORTANT COMMENT:<br />\n<br />\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/judiciary-in-contempt-of-we-people-capt.html<br />\n<br />\nTHE ATHEIST COMMIE CM OF KERALA PINARAYI VIJAYAN IS HELL BENT OF BREAKING THE SPINE OF SABARIMALA PILGRIMAGE..<br />\n<br />\nTHE MOST IMPORTANT ASPECT IS \u201cNEY ABHISHEKHAM\u201d. ( GHEE SACRIFICE )..<br />\n<br />\nIT IS NOT THE MALE HUSBAND OR SON ALONE THAT BENEFITS FROM THE PILGRIMAGE ..<br />\n<br />\nTHE WIFE FILLS UP A COCONUT WITH DESI GHEE ( USING THE MIDDLE EYE OF THE COCONUT ) IN FRONT OF THE AYYAPPA IDOL OR PICTURE OF HER HOME BESIDE A LIT LAMP..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS GHEE FILLED COCONUT IS CARRIED INSIDE THE IRUMUDI KETTU ON THE HEAD OF THE MALE PILGRIM..<br />\n<br />\nHE WILL NOT ALLOW THE IRUMUDI KETU TO TOUCH THE GROUND TILL HE CLIMBS UP THE 18 STEPS\u2026<br />\n<br />\nTHE KERALA POLICE IS DOING BLASPHEMY BY ORDERING THE PILGRIM TO OPEN THE IDRUMUDI KETTU , AS IF THERE IS A TIME BOMB INSIDE.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS GHEE IS POURED ON THE AYYAPPA IDOL INSIDE THE SANNIDHANAM.. TIMING WINDOW IS FROM 0330 AM TO 7 AM AND THEN 0830 TO 1100 AM..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS GHEE IS GIVEN BACK AS PRASADMA AND THE PILGRIM GOES BACK HOME WITH THIS GHEE FOR HIS WIFE ( OR MOTHER WHO FILLED THE COCONUT ) TO CONSUME ..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS EQUIVALENT TO THE MENSTRAUTING WOMAN UNDERTAKING THE PILGRIMAGE HERSELF..<br />\n<br />\nAS THE MALE PILGRIMS WALKS TOWARDS SABARIMALA UNDER A GURUSAMI , THEY CHANT JOYOUSLY \u201c NEY ABHISHEKAM SWAMIKKE \u201c ..<br />\n<br />\nNEY ABHISHKAM HAS PUJA TIMINGS AT DAWN ..<br />\n<br />\nIF THE PILGRIMS IS FORCED BACK BY THE KERALA POLICE ON COMMIE PINARAYI VIJAYANs ORDERS , HE CANNOT DO THE NEY ABHISHEKAM.. THE SPINE OF THIS SOLEMN ENDEAVOUR IS BROKEN..<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nFor those pilgrims who have not observed the purity ( say he masturbated ) during his trek to Sabarimala , he will not take back the ghee he brought inside the coconut, there is a container called Neythoni (Ghee Canoe) into which they pour out the ghee. He goes back home empty handed sans prasadham..<br />\n<br />\nThe wife understands as the ghee would hurt her..<br />\n<br />\nThis pilgrimage is then not considered to be ACCOMPLISHED.<br />\n<br />\nIf later he has to become a guruswamy, he has to count how many ties he took the ghee prasadam back home to the woman who filled it..<br />\n<br />\nIt has to be 18 times..<br />\n<br />\nThere is no fooling anybody here , including yourself..<br />\n<br />\nTHIS RITUAL HAS GONE ON FOR 5900 YEARS..<br />\n<br />\nNOW WE HAVE AN ATHEIST COMMIE CM NAMED PINARAYI VIJAYAN WHO HAS UNLEASHED A STALIN TYPE REIGN OF TERRROR ..<br />\n<br />\nHE HAS SELF DESTRUCTED..<br />\n<br />\nHE IS BEYOND CARE !<br />\n<br />\nCOMMUNIST PARTY IS DEAD \u2013THE LAST BASTION OF KERALA HAS CRUMBLED, DUE TO ONE MANs GOONDAGIRI..<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_10BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; \n\u0d15\u0d7d\u0d2c\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d31\u0d3f\u0d1e\u0d4d\u0d1e\u0d2a\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d4b\u0d33\u0d3f\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d41 \u0d1e\u0d2e\u0d4d\u0d2e\u0d33\u0d4d \n\u0d15\u0d2f\u0d31\u0d41 \u0d2a\u0d4a\u0d1f\u0d4d\u0d1f\u0d3f\u0d2f \u0d2a\u0d2e\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d30\u0d02...\n\n\u0d1a\u0d47\u0d31\u0d3f\u0d7d \u0d28\u0d3f\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d41 \u0d2c\u0d33\u0d7c\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d41 \u0d2a\u0d4a\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d24\u0d3f\u0d2f \n\u0d39\u0d42\u0d31\u0d3f \u0d28\u0d3f\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d41\u0d1f\u0d46 \u0d15\u0d2f\u0d4d\u0d2f\u0d3f\u0d28\u0d3e\u0d7d - \u0d28\u0d46\u0d2f\u0d4d\u200c \n\u0d1a\u0d4a\u0d31\u0d41 \u0d35\u0d46\u0d1a\u0d4d\u0d1a\u0d24\u0d41 \u0d24\u0d3f\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d41\u0d35\u0d3e\u0d7b \n\u0d15\u0d4a\u0d24\u0d3f\u0d2f\u0d47\u0d31\u0d46\u0d2f\u0d41\u0d23\u0d4d\u0d1f\u0d46\u0d7b \u0d28\u0d46\u0d1e\u0d4d\u0d1a\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d3e\u0d2f\u0d4d\u200c...\n\n\u0d35\u0d2e\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d46\u0d34\u0d41\u0d02 \u0d28\u0d3f\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d31\u0d46 \u0d2a\u0d41\u0d30\u0d3f\u0d15\u0d15\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d4a\u0d1f\u0d3f\u0d2f\u0d41\u0d1f\u0d46 \n\u0d05\u0d2e\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d41\u0d15\u0d4a\u0d23\u0d4d\u0d1f\u0d41 \u0d1e\u0d30\u0d2e\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d41\u0d15\u0d7e \n\u0d15\u0d2e\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d4a\u0d1f\u0d3f\u0d1e\u0d4a\u0d30\u0d41 \u0d36\u0d40\u0d32\u0d15\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d41\u0d1f\u0d2f\u0d41\u0d1f\u0d46 \n\u0d15\u0d2e\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d3f\u0d2a\u0d4b\u0d32\u0d46 \u0d35\u0d32\u0d3f\u0d1e\u0d4d\u0d1e\u0d41\u0d2a\u0d4b\u0d2f\u0d4d\u200c...\n\n\u0d15\u0d41\u0d1f\u0d35\u0d41\u0d2e\u0d3e\u0d2f\u0d4d\u200c \u0d2a\u0d41\u0d34 \u0d15\u0d1f\u0d35\u0d3f\u0d7d \u0d35\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d46\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d46 \n\u0d24\u0d1f\u0d35\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d3e\u0d15\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d3f\u0d2f \u0d2a\u0d48\u0d19\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d3f\u0d33\u0d3f \n\u0d12\u0d1f\u0d41\u0d35\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d40\u0d2f\u0d46\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d28\u0d46 \u0d38\u0d19\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d1f\u0d2a\u0d4d\u0d2a\u0d41\u0d34\n\u0d28\u0d1f\u0d41\u0d35\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d3e\u0d15\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d30\u0d41\u0d24\u0d3f\u0d15\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d33\u0d40...\n\n\u0d35\u0d47\u0d31\u0d46\u0d2f\u0d3e\u0d23\u0d41 \u0d35\u0d3f\u0d1a\u0d3e\u0d30\u0d2e\u0d46\u0d19\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d4d \n\u0d28\u0d47\u0d30\u0d2e\u0d3e\u0d2f\u0d24\u0d41 \u0d1a\u0d4a\u0d32\u0d4d\u0d32\u0d41\u0d35\u0d3e\u0d7b \n\u0d35\u0d46\u0d31\u0d41\u0d24\u0d46 \u0d1e\u0d3e\u0d28\u0d46\u0d28\u0d4d\u0d24\u0d3f\u0d28\u0d46\u0d30\u0d3f\u0d2f\u0d41\u0d02 \u0d35\u0d46\u0d2f\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d24\u0d4d\u0d24\u0d4d \n\u0d15\u0d2f\u0d3f\u0d32\u0d41\u0d02 \u0d15\u0d41\u0d24\u0d4d\u0d24\u0d3f \u0d28\u0d1f\u0d15\u0d4d\u0d15\u0d23\u0d4d\u200c.\ufeff</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WSaz8U82HR0/W9fZcGEASxI/AAAAAAABezI/WTW5gSyDa981d0oitirE_PtGBsCvrzEWQCLcBGAs/s1600/20180720_205704.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"1600\" data-original-width=\"1250\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-WSaz8U82HR0/W9fZcGEASxI/AAAAAAABezI/WTW5gSyDa981d0oitirE_PtGBsCvrzEWQCLcBGAs/s640/20180720_205704.jpg\" width=\"497\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nCAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<br />\n..</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "81", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/9117630503431831117/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "4361417726602833945", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2018-10-28T15:54:00+05:30", "updated": "2019-04-21T07:58:39+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNTU1ODEzNzE5MDIwCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_28.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/4361417726602833945", "title": "SANATANA DHARMA , HINDUISM EXHUMED AND RESURRECTED, PART 113 - CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><b>THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 112, BELOW--</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_27.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/10/sanatana-dharma-hinduism-exhumed-and_27.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 26.4px;\"><span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Panini's ( 5500 BC )</span>&nbsp;</span></b>Ashtadhyayi, its commentaries, and the Vakyapadiya of&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">Bhartrihari ( 7000 BC)&nbsp;</span></b>&nbsp;</span>constitute the fundamental texts for the school of Panini\u2019s grammar.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 26.4px;\"><span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 26.4px;\"><span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><span style=\"color: magenta;\">Patanjali ( 5000 BC )</span></b>&nbsp;</span>wrote the Mahabhashya, an interpretation of some of P\u00e2nini\u2019s rules written in dialogue form, and it is this work that is the basis for later commentaries on grammar and philosophy.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 26.4px;\"><span style=\"font-size: medium;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 26.4px;\"><span style=\"font-size: medium;\">The Dharmash\u00e2stras or Treatises on Law, including the well-known Laws of&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><b>Manu ( 8300 BC )</b></span></span>&nbsp;, were composed much before .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 24px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 17.6px; line-height: 26.4px;\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 18.4px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/01/manu-first-law-maker-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/01/manu-first-law-maker-capt-ajit.html</a></span></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jm7HTDocq4U/W9WSSe7FNII/AAAAAAABey0/HPThbzcbpM8ehfwzPrgskBrqN0sPKdomgCLcBGAs/s1600/vakyadpadiya-sadhanasamudesha-e1519065014521.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"311\" data-original-width=\"712\" height=\"278\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-jm7HTDocq4U/W9WSSe7FNII/AAAAAAABey0/HPThbzcbpM8ehfwzPrgskBrqN0sPKdomgCLcBGAs/s640/vakyadpadiya-sadhanasamudesha-e1519065014521.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the Vakyapadiya,\nBhartrihari moves grammatical analysis squarely into the realm of philosophy,\narguing that grammar can be consider a darshana, a \"view,\" or an\nofficial philosophical school, providing perspective and insight into ultimate\nreality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first verse\narticulates the fundamental view of his newly envisaged school:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahman is without\nbeginning and end, whose essence is the Word, who is the cause of the\nmanifested phonemes, who appears as the objects, from whom the creation of the\nworld proceeds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is the project of\nthe Vakyapadaiya to explain this verse, with all of its philosophical,\nlinguistic, and metaphysical implications. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At base, we\ncontextualize Bhartrihari's philosophical inquiry into language as being\nconditioned by the Indian culture and scriptural tradition, in which this type\nof intellectual pursuit had a soteriological purpose -the realization of\nabsolute knowledge and the spiritual liberation which ensues; thus, it is a\ndistinctively ontological reflection on language which Bhartrihari added to the\nthought of earlier grammarians. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Brahminic view of\nthe cosmos put forth in the Vedas is one of constant and cyclical creation and\ndissolution. At the dissolution of each creative cycle a seed or trace\n(samskara) is left behind out of which the next cycle arises. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is significant\nhere is that the nature of the seed from which each cycle of creation bursts\nforth is expressed as \"Divine Word\" (Daivi Vak). If language is of\ndivine origin, it can be conceived as Being Brahman expressing and embodying\nitself in the plurality of phenomena that is creation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhartrihari considers\nBrahman, the basis of reality, to be \"without beginning and end\"\n(anadi nidhanam), as a concept that is not subject to the attributes of\ntemporal sequences of events, either externally or in the succession of mental\nevents that form cognitions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word principle,\nshabda Brahman, is not defined in terms of the temporal nature of our cognitive\nstates, because it functions as the inherent, primordial ground of all\ncognitions. meaning of the term \"eternal\" or \u201cakshara\u201d as Bhartrihari\napplies it to the word-principle. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhartrihari's specialized\nway of referring to phonemes, the minimal units of meaningful sound. It seems\nthat phonemes understood in this way explain how it is the case that Word\nappears as objects. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Eternity is \u201cthat which\nappears as objects, and from whom the creation of the world proceeds.\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phonemes\nare thus the eternally possible elements that can be combined in inexhaustible\nways to manifest the plurality of nature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This principle accounts\nfor creation on a number of levels: it is the origin of consciousness, of\ncognition, sensation, language use, cognitive and experiential aspects of the\nworld. In other words, objects of thought and the relations between them are\nword-determined, regardless of whether they are objects of perception,\ninference or any other kind of knowledge. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we perceptually\napprehend external reality, we always do so in terms of names, for without\nnames objects are neither identifiable nor knowable. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Vakyapad\u00eeya, kanda\nI, Bhartrihari defines the scope of his inquiry as the subjects of grammar. Our\nspeech takes the form of the basic structures of language, and grammar deals\nwith this communicatively spoken language.&nbsp;&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The correct\nunderstanding of speech can take us to the limits of our conventional and\nspiritual capacities, and so language analysis must operate at all the\nfollowing levels: 1. sentences and words, 2. meanings corresponding to\nsentences and words, 3. the fitness or compatibility between sound and sense,\nand 4. the spiritual merit obtained by using the correct language.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In his linguistic\ntheory, Bhartrihari distinguishes between two forms of language, the spoken, or\n\u201clanguage-in-use\u201d and the analytic. The analytic or formal language emerges\nfrom a formal, abstract analysis of communicative language.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If we were to\ngather and compare various sentences and words from different contexts of use,\nwe would logically infer the basic segments (roots, stems, suffixes) that\naccount for a common logical or formal basis of denotation.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This hierarchical\nconception of language use and language meaning can be understood in the\nfollowing way,&nbsp; with the term on\nthe far right of each column understood as the originator of the term in the\nmiddle, and the term in the middle being the originator of the term on the left.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In other words, Bhartrihari's conception of utterance and understanding can be\ngrasped with the following schema under the rubric of:--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<br /></div>\n<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"MsoNormalTable\" style=\"background: white; border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .25pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .75pt; mso-border-right-alt: .25pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .75pt; mso-cellspacing: .7pt; mso-padding-alt: 0in 0in 0in 0in; mso-yfti-tbllook: 1184; width: 699px;\">\n <tbody>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<b><span style=\"border: 1pt none; font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt; padding: 0in;\">Product</span></b><span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<b><span style=\"border: 1pt none; font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt; padding: 0in;\">Producer</span></b><span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<b><span style=\"border: 1pt none; font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt; padding: 0in;\">Derivative Element</span></b><span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">Linguistic Components<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">Language-in-Use<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">Analytic Language<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">sound<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"></td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"></td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">sentences and words<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">word stems, suffixes, etc..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"></td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">sense<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">sentence meaning and word meaning<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">stem meaning and suffix meaning<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">sound and sense relations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">fitness compatibility<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">causality relations<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">purpose<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">spiritual merit<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border: solid windowtext 1.0pt; mso-border-bottom-alt: .75pt; mso-border-color-alt: windowtext; mso-border-left-alt: .25pt; mso-border-right-alt: .75pt; mso-border-style-alt: solid; mso-border-top-alt: .25pt; padding: 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt 6.0pt;\" valign=\"bottom\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal; margin-bottom: .0001pt; margin-bottom: 0in;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: inherit , serif; font-size: 10.5pt;\">correct knowledge<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n</tbody></table>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the first chapter of\nthe Vakyapadiya, Bhartrihari explains the naturalist view. Following the\npadavadins (those who regard the word as the primary indivisible unit) who\nconsider word-constituents, such as roots and suffixes, to be mere fictitious\nabstractions from words, so also the vakyavadins (those who regard the sentence\nas the indivisible unit) consider words to be imaginary abstractions from the\nsentence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The naturalists, such\nas Panini, believe that language has an invariant form expressed in grammar.\nThey therefore give epistemic primacy to spoken language; formal language is\nonly an \u201cappearance\u201d and secondary aid to understanding. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The conventionalists,\non the other hand, hold that the analytic language is primary in that it\ncontains within it all the structural features that may be used to create\nmeaningful speech.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhartrihari puts forth\na theory of language which, rather than starting by taking fundamental\nontological, epistemological or social sides in these well-established debates,\nstarts from the question of how meaning happens, how it emerges from the acts\nof both speaker and audience, and, constructing this theory first, what he\nbelieves to be appropriate metaphysical, epistemological and soteriological\nimplications are drawn from it.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For Bhartrihari,\nlinguistic meaning cannot be conveyed or accounted for by the physical\nutterance and perception of sounds, so he puts forth the sphota theory: the\ntheory which posits the meaning-unit, which for him is the sentence, as a\nsingle entity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The meaning of the\nsentence, the speech-unit, is one entire cognitive content (samvit). The\nsentence is indivisible (akhanda) and owes its cognitive value to the\nmeaning-whole. Thus, its meaning is not reducible to its parts, the individual\nwords which are distinguished only for the purposes of convention or\nexpression. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The differentiated\nword-meanings, which are also ontological categories, are the abstracted\n\"pieces\" we produce using imaginative construction, or vikalpa.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sphota entails a kind of mental perception which is described as a moment of\nrecognition, an instantaneous flash (pratibha), whereby the hearer is made\nconscious, through hearing sounds, of the latent meaning unit already present\nin his consciousness (unconscious). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sentence employs\nanalyzable units to express its meaning, but that meaning emerges out of the\nparticular concatenation of those units, not because those units are meaningful\nin themselves. We analyze language by splitting it up into words, prefixes,\nsuffixes, etc\u2026.but this is indicative of the fact that we \u201cmisunderstand\u201d the\nfundamental oneness of the speech-unit. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Words are only\nabstracted meaning possibilities in this sense, whereas the uttered sentence is\nthe realization of a meaning-whole irreducible to those parts in themselves.\nThis fundamental unity seems to apply, also, to any language taken as a whole. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is only those who do\nnot know the language and grammar thoroughly who analyze it into words, in\norder to get a connected meaning.&nbsp; This\nis why pretenders like Wendy Doniger and Sheldon Pollock ( with a Monier\nWilliams dictionary between their legs ) always get it wrong.. Sanskrit is not\na stupid language like English.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhartrihari's\nrecognition of the theoretical indivisibility of the sentence resonates with\nthe contemporary linguistic view of learning sentences as wholes\u2014in Sanskrit\nyou don\u2019t &nbsp;build new sentences from\nlearned first sentences through analogical reasoning..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We might think of this\nunit of linguistic potency, the sphota, as the cognitive/propositional whole\ncontent of meaning that can be transposed into different languages, while the\nactual word-sounds comprise the contents of the \"speech-act\". But\nwhat holds the act to its ability to convey intended meanings? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The words sounded by a\nplurality of speakers comprise the physical manifestation of v\u00e2k or\nvaikhar\u00ee-v\u00e2k and it is upon this form of v\u00e2k that physical objects as objective\nforms are modeled.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The unity that underlies these objective referents and\nmeanings, however, is known as the intuited v\u00e2k-pashyati-v\u00e2k, which makes\npossible the unmediated understanding of a complete linguistic expression. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This intuitive level of\nunderstanding, constitutive of the sphota, is teleological in its nature and\nstructure in that it contains all potential possibilities of meaning-bearing\ndhvanis and their order of manifestation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But, what guarantees\nthat the hearer of speech properly comprehends what is uttered? <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the second book of\nthe V\u00e2kyapad\u00eeya, Bhartrihari states:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sentence meaning is\nproduced by word meanings but is not constituted by them. Its form is that\nIntuition, that innate \"know how\" awareness (pratibha) possessed by\nall beings. It is a cognitive state evident to the hearer\u2026not describable or\ndefinable, but all practical activities depend on it directly or through\nrecollection of it.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pratibha intuition can\nbe characterized as shabda, the very same speech principle externalized in the\nutterances of speakers, as it operates within the hearer, causing her to\ninstantaneously comprehend the meaning of the utterance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;However, linguistic convention, shared by\nspeaker and hearer, cannot account for the flash of comprehension. If that were\nthe case, we would not have instances where communication breaks down in spite\nof the shared language between speaker and hearer. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The comprehension of\nmeaning lies in the sphota that is already present in the hearer's awareness.\nAs he hears the succession of audible phonemes, the latent and undifferentiated\nlanguage potency within him is brought to \"fruition\" in the form of\ngrasping the speaker\u2019s meaning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Thus, while the audible words are necessary\nfor such verbal comprehension to occur in the hearer, they are not sufficient.\nIt is his own ability to understand meaning referred to by these words, by\nvirtue of sharing the same sphota with the speaker, which completes the act of\ncognition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as various\nsentences might sound different in the mouths of different speakers and yet\nconvey the same meanings, various Vedas may seem different in form and style,\nbut there is a unity carried by the underlying sphota, which ensures that it is\nthe same truth, or dharma that is expressed throughout the texts. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bearing in mind that\nBrahman is the ultimate referent of all speech forms, this higher reality is\nmanifested in the sacred texts-whose efficacy (ritual, soteriological,\nepistemological) depends upon our ability to correctly apprehend its meaning.\nThe sphota concept makes such interpretation possible. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again, the sphota\nexpresses a meaning-whole behind individual letters and words. The implication\nfor the truth of Vedic discourse is clear, for that truth is already present in\nthe speaker (the Veda) and is potentially present in the consciousness of the\nhearers (the practitioners).</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are three kinds\nof evidences accepted by the learned scholars in Vedic culture. One evidence is\npratyak\u1e63a. &nbsp;Pratyak\u1e63a means direct perception.\nJust like I am seeing you, you are seeing me. I am present, you are present.\nThis is direct perception. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And there is another\nevidence which is called anumana. Suppose in that room, and I am coming just\nnow, I do not know whether any person there is or not. But there is some sound,\nI can imagine, \"Oh, there is somebody.\"&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is called anumana. In\nlogic it is called hypothesis. That is also evidence. If by my bona fide\nsuggestions I can give evidence, that is also accepted. So direct evidence,\nand, what is called, hypothesis or suggestion evidence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;But the strong evidence is Shabda-pramana. Shabda-prama\u1e47a\nmeans as soon as there is evidence in the Vedic literature, \"This is\nthis,\" you have to accept. That's all. Then your knowledge is perfect\nbecause you are accepting things from the perfect source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to\nBhartrihari's theory, we can justify this particular philosophical method as\nrevelatory by using the concept of shabda pramana.&nbsp; Vedic evidence should be taken in such a way\nthat no argument. There is meaning; there is no contradiction.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda-pram\u0101\u1e47a means to take the truth from\nthe highest authority. Veda srutis have no mortal author. They have been\ndownloaded from Akasha by Maharishi seers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is faith in Vedanta as a\nPramana, a means of knowledge. Prama\u1e47a refers to epistemology in Vedanta--\nYukti which means active application of epistemology or what one already knows..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddhaavaan labhathe jnanam--- That person alone who has shraddha can secure\nwisdom.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha means unwavering faith in the Vedas. No spiritual progress is\npossible without shraddha.&nbsp; From shraddha\ncomes nistha or one-pointed devotion and from nistha comes\nself-realization.&nbsp; If the faith is\nflickering, it will die soon and the aspirant will be drifted aimlessly hither\nand thither.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is a Sanskrit /Malayalam&nbsp;\nword -- an unshakable conviction in our journey. Experience can never\nremove ignorance, as experience does not negate ignorance.&nbsp; Neither action nor experience can remove\nignorance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The scriptures give a\ntechnical definition to pramana<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are five\nconditions for a thing to be a pramana;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1)&nbsp; It has to produce knowledge. 2) It has to\nproduce a new knowledge. 3) It has to produce uncontradicted knowledge. 4) It\nhas to produce a doubtless knowledge. 5) It has to produce a useful knowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">anadhigata, abAdhita\nasandigdha phalavat jn~Ana janakam pramANam.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--.&nbsp; The pramANa should produce knowledge (jn~Ana\njanakatvam). Mystic experiences or actions cannot produce knowledge, hence they\nare not pramANas. Upanishadik statements do reveal the self and hence produce\nknowledge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">---. What a pramANa\ntalks about should not be talked about by any other pramANa. (anadhigatatvam).\nIt should be a new knowledge not gained in any other way.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">---. What a pramana\nreveals should not be contradicted by any other pramana (abadhitatvam); for e.g.,\nthe eye gives form knowledge, so it is giving us a knowledge which is new.&nbsp;&nbsp; Also, the form knowledge given by the eye\ncan never be negated by the ear. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ear can never come\nup with a knowledge that says, the form reported by the eye is wrong.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pram\u0101\u1e47a forms one part\nof a tripu\u0163i (trio) of concepts, which describe the ancient Indian view on how\nknowledge is gained. The other two concepts are knower and knowable, each\ndiscussed in how they influence the knowledge, by their own characteristic and\nthe process of knowing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The two are called\nPramat\u0157 ( the subject, the knower) and Prameya ( the object, the knowable).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pramana, a valid means\nof knowledge for revealing the corresponding objects.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We should have a\nsimilar trust in Vedanta because Vedanta is a Pramana for the truth about the\nSelf.&nbsp;&nbsp; The Self is not available for\nperception.&nbsp;&nbsp; It cannot be grasped by the\norgans of perception, the mind, or words.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Self cannot be\ncomprehended by any means of knowledge other than Vedanta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha, is surrender\nto the Pramana so that the Pramana can operate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pramana&nbsp; literally means \"proof\" and\n\"means of knowledge\". It refers to epistemology in Indian\nphilosophies, and is one of the key, much debated fields of study in Hinduism<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a theory of\nknowledge, and encompasses one or more reliable and valid means by which human\nbeings gain accurate, true knowledge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ancient and medieval Indian texts\nidentify six pramanas as correct means of accurate knowledge and to truths:\nperception (Sanskrit pratyak\u1e63a), inference (anumana), comparison and\nanalogy(upamana), postulation, derivation from circumstances (arthapatti),\nnon-perception, negative/cognitive proof (anupalabdhi) and word, testimony of\npast or present reliable experts (\u015aabda).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each of these are\nfurther categorized in terms of conditionality, completeness, confidence and\npossibility of error, Prama\u1e47a literally means \"proof\". The word also\nrefers to a concept and field of Indian philosophy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The concept is derived\nfrom the Sanskrit root, prama which means \"correct notion, true knowledge,\nbasis, foundation, accurate notion\".&nbsp;\nThe concept Pramana implies that which is a \"means of acquiring\nprama or certain, correct, true knowledge\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Accepting Veda (sruti\n)&nbsp; as a pramana is first step of vedantik\nenquiry.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta being a\npramana, no experience can ever contradict it; since the definition says that a\npramana can never be contradicted. It is absurd to call vedanta&nbsp; (sruti ) a non pramana. It would be equally\nabsurd to call shraddhda in veda as \u2018rigid belief\u2019. &nbsp;ShraddhA cannot be translated into belief at\nall.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Shraddha or trust\nthat we have in Vedanta enables us to maintain a certain frame of mind wherein\nwe don\u2019t question what Vedanta says, but try to understand what it says.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha or trust does\nnot mean that we have to blindly accept whatever the teacher tells us. It only\nmeans that we give it the benefit of the doubt and look upon it with a certain\nreverence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha, trust /\nfaith,&nbsp; must arise in its own way.&nbsp; It must be discovered. It cannot be commanded.\nThis reverence for scripture cannot be thrust upon anybody.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We discover it as we\nget exposed to Vedanta, appreciate its profundity and clarity, and see how it\nreleases us from different notions and complexes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as we cannot make\nourselves love someone, we cannot make ourselves have Shraddha.&nbsp;&nbsp; Love has to manifest itself.&nbsp; Similarly, Shraddha is not something that we\ncan command; it has to happen. Shraddha, trust and reverence, is essential to\nlearn and enjoy an open mind.&nbsp; An open\nmind is willing to shed its conclusions and prejudices and is ready to learn\nand change<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In having Shraddha,\nthere is trust, faith, reverence, devotion, openness, and freedom. In fact,\nthis is the trust where there is freedom.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word \u201cfaith\u201d scares\na Hindu.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A&nbsp; Hindu free of dogma ( like in other single\nholy book religions ) is skeptical when this question of trust / faith arises\nbecause faith is always understood to be blind faith.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But here we are talking\nnot about blind faith, but enlightened faith, a faith that we discover as a\nresult of self verification. As we listen and understand Vedanta and try to\nassimilate and implement it in our lives, we discover its validity and take the\nnext step.&nbsp; We do not simply believe it,\nbut proceed as we discover the validity of the truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta says that\nhappiness is not to be found outside, but is to be discovered within ourselves\nas it is our own nature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha or reverential\nfaith enables that learning frame of mind and, therefore, is freedom.&nbsp;&nbsp; Such a mind remains free from doubts and\nquestions and open to the teacher and the teaching.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Krishna also gives\nimportance to Shraddha and says in the Bhagavad Gita:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One who has Shraddha (\nnot BHAKTI ) gains knowledge. Shraddha is defined as trust or faith in the\nwords of Vedanta pending verification.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is faith in\nVedanta as a Pramana, a means of knowledge for knowing the Self, just as eyes\nare a means of knowledge with respect to colour and form. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vedanta is not to be\nlooked upon as speculation or philosophy.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\nAgain , shraddha is not blind faith, but enlightened faith based on\nverification.&nbsp; We discover faith when we\nimplement Vedanta in our lives and verify whether what the teachings say is\ntrue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith is the ability to\nbelieve what we do not see. The reward of faith is to see what we did not\nbelieve.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shraddha is more than\nmere faith.&nbsp;&nbsp; It also implies\nself\u2013reliance, an independent sense of right and wrong,&nbsp; reliance on conscience and the courage of\none\u2019s own conviction&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith in Sanatana\nDharma begins as an experiment and ends as an experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith expressed in\naction is a sure means of realization.&nbsp;\nFaith is not blind.&nbsp; It is the\nwillingness to try free of threats of dogma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Faith is the belief in\nthe unknown.&nbsp; Faith heals, faith creates,\nfaith works wonders, faith moves mountains. Faith is the searchlight for\nfinding brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
