Language is similar to light and\nconsciousness as that it can reveal itself and also other things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The process of\nrevelation of word by the sound is from the indeterminate stage ,to the determinate\nstage, it begins from complete ignorance, passes through practical knowledge\nand ends in complete knowledge.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He gives\nan analogy to illustrate the process of&nbsp;\nomprehension of Sphota. It is that of a student&nbsp; trying to learn a verse byheart by reading\nit&nbsp; repeatedly. It is the last reading\naided by the&nbsp; impressions left behind by\nthe previous readings helps&nbsp; the student\nto know the verse fully.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To Bhartrhari&nbsp; the eternal word Sphota is without parts. He\nsaid that everything is a manifestation of the. ultimate Reality, Brahman. The\nspeaker, the words which he utters, the object which the words denote and the\nlistener are all emanations from this ultimate&nbsp;\nprinciple.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He declared it in the\nfirst part of his&nbsp; Vakyapadiya. He begins\nthe discussion on the&nbsp; theory of Sphota\nwith the observation that words or&nbsp;\nsentences can be considered under two aspects - sound-patterns and\nmeaning-bearing symbols.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to\nBhartrhari, the speechprinciple&nbsp; has\nthree stages in the course of its manifestation, namely, para, madhyama and\nvaikhari. &nbsp;Pasyanti is the supreme\nreality, sabdabrahman. It has been has been identified with pratibha, the\nprinciple of consciousness. There is no real distinction between speech and\nthought at this stage.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madhyama is the\nintermediate stage which lies between PasyantI and Vaikhari. It can be\ncomprehended by the intellect. All the elements linguistically relevant to the\nsentence are present in a latent form at this stage. This corresponds to\nprakrtadhvani.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"file:///C:/Users/win7/Downloads/Nitishatakam.pdf\">file:///C:/Users/win7/Downloads/Nitishatakam.pdf</a></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/qoXWMAvqVAw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/qoXWMAvqVAw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sphota is the inner mystical\nsound.. It is Sphota that makes the meaning comprehensible. The divine nature\nof speech, rather &nbsp;its being the great\nGod himself, the creative and illuminative power of the word, and the different\nlevels of speech\u2014these doctrines which formed the main plank of the philosophy\nof &nbsp;language in Indian thought,\u2014all stem\nfrom the Vedas which is 400 centuries old..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Sanskrit, in\nSanskrit, is spelled Sa\u1e41sk\u1e5bta, and means \"refined\" or \"well\nmade.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ancillary\ndisciplines of the Veda, phonetics (Sikfa), grammar (Vyakarana language\nanalysis) and Nirukla (definitions of terms) were directly connected with the\nVeda.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sciences of yoga,\nmedicine (Ayurveda), astronomy/astrology (Jyotisha), sound (Mantra),\nmathematics, and many others, developed over thousands of years, and the\naccumulated knowledge was recorded in Sanskrit, both aurally (via chanting) and\nin writing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound is the highest\npriority in Sanskrit. In the beginning, the sacred texts called Veda-s were not\nwritten down, only chanted. Having a language that is 100% phonetic makes it\nmuch easier to preserve these sacred sounds.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Because most people automatically\nblend words together when speaking fast, sound blending rules were created,\nensuring the spoken and the written always match. Pronunciation has always been\nextremely important, since all sound has an energetic effect.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The science of\nMantra developed from this idea, and Sanskrit sounds are made in specific mouth\npositions long the human palate, each causing vibration to travel in a different\ndirection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit is 100%\nphonetic: each written character is always pronounced the same way. This makes\nSanskrit very easy to learn and pronounce. A spelling bee in Sanskrit would be\nimpossible. Rhythm is built into the language, each syllable being either short\n(one beat) or long (2 or more beats).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit is a natural\nlanguage, meaning its sounds are said to truly represent what they mean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reading Sanskrit words\nrendered in English letters with no diacritical marks, and pronouncing them as\nan English word, almost always results in poor pronunciation, and often the\nexpression of a completely different energy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here are some blatant examples:\nmAla means \"impurity\" and in Ayurveda translates to \"SHIT\"\nmAAla means \" 108 bead rosary\"&nbsp; .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanting a mantra,\nespecially a single-seed \"bija\" mantra (click here for examples),\nreleases specific energy into the world.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The more the sound (\u0325\u015babda),\nintention, meaning (artha) and visualization (yantra) align, the more powerful\nthe desired effect will be. Even if the mantra is recited mentally, it is still\nbased on the audible sound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chanting divine names\nof gods and goddesses invokes the energies they represent. If these are\nmispronounced, then the resulting vibration may shift into something that is\nnot intended.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The word Vak comes from\nthe root of Vac, which means \u201c to speak\u201d.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;In the book \"Aitareya\nBrahmana\" Speech has been compared to the ocean on account of its\ninexhaustible nature.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vowels were compared\nto the day and the consonants&nbsp; to the\nnight. The consonants were considered pearls in the&nbsp; String of vowels, perhaps due to the superior\nperceptibility of the vowels in normal speech.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian grammarians had\ngiven so much importance to speech that they even considered speech the only\nornament of human beings and they said that there is nothing beyond\nspeech.&nbsp; They tried to define speech and\nto understand the phenomena&nbsp; of speech\nproduction and perception.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phonetics included, the\nstudy of speech sounds, their pitch, duration, intensity, modulation and\nconjunction. It is concerned with the physical properties of speech sounds or\nsigns (phones): their physiological production, acoustic properties, auditory\nperception, and neurophysiological status.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phonology, on the other hand, is\nconcerned with the abstract, grammatical characterization of systems of sounds\nor signs.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Vedas were transmitted orally\nfor 330 centuries before they were penned down 70 centuries ago ..&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">When Vedas\nwere penned down we had Kerala Namboodiri oral route Veda sruti experts (\nincluding Panini) &nbsp;settling down on the\nbanks of the river Saraswati.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The\nSaraswati river dried up a thousand years later by which time most of the\nancient knowledge has been penned down, except for some Atharva Veda vahikaran mantras\nwhich could be misused.&nbsp; ..</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">pade na var\u1e47\u0101 vidyante\nvar\u1e47e\u1e63v avayav\u0101 na ca / v\u0101ky\u0101t pad\u0101n\u0101m atyanta\u1e43 pravibh\u0101go na ka\u015b cana //\nVP:1.74 //<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u201c There is no phonemes\n(Varna)&nbsp; in the word; and, nor are there\nany parts of the phonemes.&nbsp; It is\nentirely not possible to separate words from the sentence \u201d.</span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All phonetics\nhas three basic areas of study:--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Articulatory phonetics:\nthe study of the organs of speech and their use in producing speech sounds by\nthe speaker.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Acoustic phonetics: the\nstudy of the physical transmission of speech sounds from the speaker to the\nlistener.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Auditory phonetics: the\nstudy of the reception and perception of speech sounds by the listener.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Panini\u2019s grammar formed\nthe basis of modern linguistics and described a number of important phonetic\nprinciples. P\u0101\u1e47ini provided an account of the phonetics of voicing, describing\nresonance as being produced either by tone, when vocal folds are closed, or\nnoise, when vocal folds are open..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Speech sounds are\ngenerally produced by the modification of an airstream exhaled from the lungs.\nThe respiratory organs used to create and modify airflow are divided into three\nregions: the vocal tract (supralaryngeal), the larynx, and the subglottal\nsystem.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The airstream can be either egressive (out of the vocal tract) or\ningressive (into the vocal tract). In pulmonic sounds, the airstream is\nproduced by the lungs in the subglottal system and passes through the larynx\nand vocal tract.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glottalic sounds use an airstream created by movements of the\nlarynx without airflow from the lungs. Clicks or lingual ingressive sounds\ncreate an airstream using the tongue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A midsagittal view of\nthe mouth with numbers marking places of articulation.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Passive and active\nplaces of articulation: (1) Exo-labial; (2) Endo-labial; (3) Dental; (4)\nAlveolar; (5) Post-alveolar; (6) Pre-palatal; (7) Palatal; (8) Velar; (9)\nUvular; (10) Pharyngeal; (11) Glottal; (12) Epiglottal; (13) Radical; (14)\nPostero-dorsal; (15) Antero-dorsal; (16) Laminal; (17) Apical; (18) Sub-apical\nor sub-laminal.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-VM7HEwu7TVE/W9vwAvioPKI/AAAAAAABe0I/a3wiswG6RacCkGx5GBuv9KWa9ZvG4rl0ACLcBGAs/s1600/220pwwwx-Places_of_articulation.svg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"275\" data-original-width=\"220\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-VM7HEwu7TVE/W9vwAvioPKI/AAAAAAABe0I/a3wiswG6RacCkGx5GBuv9KWa9ZvG4rl0ACLcBGAs/s640/220pwwwx-Places_of_articulation.svg.png\" width=\"512\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The overall aim of\nSanskrit Grammar was not to list out the rules and to standardize the language;\nbut, to aptly bring out the intended meaning of the structure of words..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sanskrit Grammar was an attempt to purify (samskruta), to discipline and to\nexplain the behavior of the spoken language, so that the inner meaning could\nshine forth unhindered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bharthari\u2019s major work,\nVakyapadiya, discusses the ways in which the outer word-form could unite with\nits inner meaning.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-0Gvy5mBcipE/WlAJZNfU3zI/AAAAAAABXsU/wZaBJr4cOoclmnshY0dz6Y3NbokDpLaaACK4BGAYYCw/s35/*\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; max-width: 36px; padding: 5px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c2924249917854403916\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; THE LAST BASTION IN KERALA HAS CRUMBLED..<br />\n<br />\nONCE A STRONGMAN PINARAYI VIJAYAN IS A PATHETIC SHADOW OF HIMSELF AFTER HAVING SELF DESTRUCTED OVER THE SABARIMALA ISSUE..<br />\n<br />\nPINARAYI VIJAYAN THINKS HE CAN REMAIN AFLOAT USING THE POLICE STALIN STYLE.. HE CANNOT.<br />\n<br />\nPOLITICS IN KERALA WAS LIKE A PENDULAM-- SWINGING FROM LDF TO UDF.. ANTI- INCUMBENCY FACTOR RULES KERALA.. QUID PRO QUO WENT ON.. YOU DONT EXPOSE US, WE DONT EXPOSE YOU..<br />\n<br />\nNOW THAT COMMUNISM IS DEAD IN KERALA, THE CORRUPT COMMIE KERALA MINISTERS WHO USED BENAMI MALAYALIs TO RUN THEIR BUSINESSES IN GULF WILL SOON BE IN JAIL..<br />\n<br />\nAN AUSSIE WOMAN NAMED GAIL SMEARED MATA AMRITANANDAMAYIs NAME BY CALLING HER A SEXUAL PREDATOR AND A MAD VIOLENT WOMAN..<br />\n<br />\nCOMMIE JOHN BRITTAS WENT ALL THE WAY TO AUSTRALIA TO GIVE THIS WHITE WOMAN A PLATFORM TO AIR HER FOUL LIES..<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\"><br />https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gail_Tredwell</span><br />\n<br />\nManaging Director of COMMIE 'Kairali TV' John Brittas was appointed Media Advisor to Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan in June 2016..</div>\n<div>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">COMMIES ALI ZEIDAN ( LIBYA ) BABURAM BHATTARAI ( NEPAL ) ARE EX-JNU STUDENTS WHO CONDUCTED THE MURDER OF GADDAFI/ NEPAL ROYAL FAMILY..</span></b></div>\n<br />\nAFTER THE NEPAL ROYALTY MASSACRE JOHN BRITTAS WENT TO COVER THE ELECTIONS-- WHEN COMMIES CAME INTO POWER..<br />\n<br />\nDEEP STATE WAS BEHIND THE NEPAL ROYAL FAMILY MASSACRE..<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nepalese_royal_massacre</span><br />\n<br />\nPrince Paras, son of ousted King Gyanendra and cousin brother of Dipendra, came to the palace dinner party that night accompanied by a person wearing a Dipendra look-alike mask, who shot Dipendra dead first before other royal family members were killed.<br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">Dipendra was mortally wounded by a gunshot to the left side of the head, while Dipendra was right-handed. It aint suicide..</span></div>\n<br />\nThese are things that killers do NOT plan in advance.<br />\n<br />\nTHE COMMIE NEPALESE CIVIL WAR ( 20,600 PEOPLE MASSACRED ) AND OVERTHROW OF THE 241 YEARS OLD HINDU SHAH GORKHA MONARCHY WAS HATCHED IN JNU , BY THE KOSHER DEEP STATE ..<br />\n<br />\nA 100% HINDU STRONGHOLD OF NEPAL IS NOW ATHEIST COMMIE.<br />\n<br />\nHOW DID THEY MANAGE TO DESTROY THE FAITH OF THE POPULATION OF AN ENTIRE NATION? BY MAKING THE HINDU SELF LOATHING !!..<br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<b style=\"color: magenta; font-size: x-large;\">THE ANNUAL ANIMAL MASSACRE OF NEPAL WAS PLANNED IN JNU.. THIS BLOGSITE STOPPED IT..</b></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/11/all-animal-sacrifices-in-hindu-temples.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">IN HINDU TEMPLES ONE DROP OF BLOOD ( EVEN FROM A CUT ON THE PUJARIs BODY ) WAS ENOUGH, TO STOP ALL RITUALS FOR A PURIFICATION CEREMONY. AND HERE HINDUS WERE FOOLED INTO MERRILY SACRIFICING ANIMALS AND DRINKING BLOOD AND THROWING BLOOD ON THE IDOL INSIDE TEMPLES.</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/03/kodungallur-bharani-festival-capt-ajit.html</span><br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_41BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; text-decoration-line: none;\">October 17, 2018 at 7:34 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_80MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nMANU ( 8300 BC ) , PATANJALI ( 5500 BC ) AND<b><span style=\"color: red;\"> BHARTRHARI ( 7000 BC )</span></b> GETS THE VADAKAYIL PRIZE ( BELATED )..<br />\n<br />\nAAA ) HERE IS THE LIST OF MAHA MERUS WHO FOOLED THE WORLD , WHOM I HAVE TRASHED INTO THE GARBAGE BIN OF THE PLANET.<br />\n<br />\nGARBAGE BUCKET LIST:<br />\n<br />\n1) BERTRAND RUSSEL<br />\n2) ROMILA THAPAR<br />\n3) IRFAN HABIB<br />\n4) NOAM CHOMSKY<br />\n5) RAMCHANDRA GUHA<br />\n6) SHELDON POLLOCK<br />\n7) SIGMUND FREUD<br />\n8) GEORG WILHELM HEGEL<br />\n9) AMARTYA SEN<br />\n10) WENDY DONIGER<br />\n11) FREIDRICH WILHELM NIETZSCHE<br />\n12) IMMANUEL KANT<br />\n13 ) BARUCH SPINOZA<br />\n14) ALBERT EINSTEIN<br />\n15) ISAAC NEWTON<br />\n16) GUGLEILMO MARCONI<br />\n17) CHARLES DARWIN<br />\n18) KARL MARX<br />\n19) MAX WEBER<br />\n20) THOMAS ALVA EDISON<br />\n21) FIBONACCI<br />\n22) BARKHA DUTT<br />\n23) ADMIRAL LN RAMDAS , WIFE LALITA AND DAUGHTER KAVITA.<br />\n24) EDWARD BERNAYS<br />\n25) JOHN DEWEY<br />\n26) GEORGE IVANOVICH GURDJEIFF<br />\n27) PETER D OUPENSKY<br />\n28) OPRAH WINFREY<br />\n29) RICHARD BANDLER AND JOHN GRINDER<br />\n30) CHRISTIANE AMANPOUR<br />\n31) STEPHEN HAWKING<br />\n32) SIDNEY HOOK<br />\n33) ALFRED KINSEY<br />\n34) BARACK OBAMA<br />\n35) AYN RAND<br />\n36) WILHELM WUNDT<br />\n<br />\nNOTE: MENTAL MIDGETS LIKE ROMILA THAPAR , IRFAN HABIB , RAMACHANDRA GUHA, SHELDON POLLOCK, WENDY DONIGER , BARKHA DUTT , RAMDAS FAMILY MUST BE THANKFUL THAT THEY ARE INCLUDED AMONG A LIST OF CEREBRAL GIANTS<br />\n<br />\n#########################<br />\n<br />\nBBB ) HERE ARE PEOPLE WHO MADE A DENT IN THE UNIVERSE\u2014 THEY GET THE \"VADAKAYIL PRIZE\". THIS IS NOT A VESTED \u201cNOBEL PRIZE \u201c<br />\n<br />\n1) NIKOLA TESLA<br />\n2) DIMITRI MENDELEYEEV<br />\n3) IE IRODOV<br />\n4) ARYABHATTA<br />\n5) SRINIVASAN RAMANUJAN<br />\n6) CHANAKYA<br />\n7) ADI SHANKARACHARYA<br />\n8) APOLLONIUS ( AN INDIAN SAGE \u2013WHO LEGACY WAS SHIFTED ON TO A COOKED UP JESUS IN 325 AD )<br />\n9) \"JOHN DOE\"<br />\n10) JULIAN ASSANGE<br />\n11) SWAMI CHINMAYANANDA<br />\n12) GARY STEPHEN WEBB<br />\n13) GEORGE ORWELL.<br />\n13) CESAR MILLAN<br />\n14) HENRY FORD.<br />\n15) PANINI<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>16) BHARTRHARI</b></span><br />\n17) PATANJALI<br />\n18) MANU<br />\n<br />\nCCC) DOWN THE SHIT HOLE----<br />\n<br />\n1) SUHEL SETH<br />\n2) PRITISH NANDI<br />\n3) DILIP CHERIAN<br />\n4) PRANNOY JAMES ROY<br />\n5) AROON PURIE<br />\n6) VINEET JAIN<br />\n7) SHEKHAR GUPTA<br />\n8) SAGARIKA GHOSE AND HUSBAND RAJDEEP SARDESAI<br />\n9) SHOBHAA DE<br />\n10) SIDHARTH VARADARAJAN AND WIFE NANDINI SUNDAR<br />\n11) KAMALHAASAN<br />\n12) AUDREY TRUSCHKE<br />\n13) NOSTRODAMUS<br />\n14) MANI SHANKAR AIYAR<br />\n15) VERGHESE KURIEN<br />\n16) MS SWAMINATHAN<br />\n17 DEVDUTT PATTANAIK<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sphota is derived from\nthe world Sphut&nbsp; meaning to burst or to\nopen like a bud in Sanskrit and Malayalam.&nbsp;\n&nbsp;The implication is (as the bud\nopens) as the word is sounded or articulated, the meaning of the word is\nrevealed.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The letter or letters\nby themselves carry no meaning until we connect them with an object or idea. &nbsp;When that object or idea is cognized, Sphota\ntakes place.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada is the hidden\nenergy that connects the outer and inner cosmos. Nada yoga, is based on the\npremise that the entire universe consists of sound vibrations called nadas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The term 'Nada' is a\nSanskrit/ Malayalam word which means pure sound.&nbsp; 'Nada' is a combination of\n'Nakar' means vital force and 'Dakar' means energy.. &nbsp;the interaction between these two creates Nada\nor sound.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nada manifests sphota\nand sphota conveys meaning.&nbsp;&nbsp; This sound\nis perceptible only to a Rishi.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nad is flow; Nada is\nsound.&nbsp; Maharishis seers had the Divine\nears other than the anatomical ears to hear them<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nada is\ndistinguished into 22 varieties, produced by the twenty two upward&nbsp; Nadis situated in different parts of the\nbody, such as, heart, throat and head. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These 22 grades are\ncalled as Srutis, because of their audibility and these are in the increasing\norder of pitch.. The Natya Shastra identifies and discusses twenty two shruti and\nseven swara per octave<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: white; line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 6.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 6.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shruti table below shows the mathematical\nratios considered to correspond to the system described by Bharata with the\ncomparable notes in common Western 12-TET&nbsp;tuning.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background: white; line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 6.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 6.0pt;\">\n<br /></div>\n<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" class=\"MsoNormalTable\" style=\"background: #F8F9FA; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mand\u0101<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">243/128<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">1110<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">496.6798<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n<tr>\n  <td style=\"border-top: none; border: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chandovat\u012b<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">1200<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">523.2511<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n  <td style=\"border-bottom: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-left: none; border-right: solid #A2A9B1 1.0pt; border-top: none; mso-border-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid #A2A9B1 .75pt; padding: 2.4pt 4.8pt 2.4pt 4.8pt;\"><div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%; margin-bottom: 12.0pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-top: 12.0pt;\">\n<span style=\"color: #222222; font-family: &quot;arial&quot; , &quot;sans-serif&quot;; font-size: 10.5pt; line-height: 150%;\">523.2511<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</td>\n </tr>\n</tbody></table>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jGdCV2BEDj8/W9RFYxKgy-I/AAAAAAABeyE/3gglZO-bGiYNkfnsSeNeDEurOkZo_e-HgCLcBGAs/s1600/3VTTT1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"400\" data-original-width=\"640\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-jGdCV2BEDj8/W9RFYxKgy-I/AAAAAAABeyE/3gglZO-bGiYNkfnsSeNeDEurOkZo_e-HgCLcBGAs/s640/3VTTT1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhartrhari&nbsp; deals with Sphota at two levels: one on the\nmetaphysical plane and the other on the empirical plane. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Sphota here is more than a theory of\nlanguage.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The principle that is involved\nhere is: the Brahman first manifested itself as Sound and then as form. The\nSphota, Sabda-Brahman, the manifester as Logos or Word, is the power through\nwhich the Lord manifests in the universe.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liberation is achieved when one\nattains unity with that \u2018supreme word principle\u2019. Within this theory,\nconsciousness and thought are intertwined; and <span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Grammar becomes a path to\nliberation</span>.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This metaphysical Sphota-vada is a monistic philosophy based in\nSanskrit grammar.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sound-meaning\njuxtaposition of Sphota has been seen to provide a conceptual basis for the\ntheory of mantras or sacred chants \u2013 the regular chanting or repetition of\nmantras could reignite the latent Atman in human consciousness, giving a\n\u201cbursting forth\u201d Sphota- flash vision of the Self, the awakening of the Brahman\nthrough language.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This sudden glimpse of enlightenment through\nthe transformative power of words lies at the root of the Sphota idea &nbsp;&nbsp;At the individual level, Sphota is the.idea\nwhich flashes on the mind when a sound is uttered.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though the Sphota is\nrevealed in stages by each succeeding sound; it is, by itself, \u2018one and\nindivisible\u2019. The sounds uttered (words) are merely parts of a sentence that\naid to reveal this Sphota.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The \"Spota\nvada\" says that there are different levels that it can reach the human\nlevel. &nbsp;&nbsp;It is categorised as:Para, Pasyanti, Madhyama,\nand Vaikhari.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rigveda stated 7000\nyears ago that speech process has four stages. These four stages are Para,\nPasyanti, Madhyama and Vaikhari.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sphota is para vak, the\nconsciousness/awareness as essence of utterances which precedes pasyanti,\nmadhyama and vaikhari in the speaker / teacher and succeeds in listener /\nstudent &nbsp;and transforms itself to be\nthese three vaks.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grammarians classify\nVak into subtle and gross forms. Of these, Para and Pashyanti are the subtle\nforms of Vak; while Madhyama and Vaikhari are its gross forms.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">According to\nBhartrhari, the process of manifestation or transformation of the speech\nprinciple (Sabda tattva) or the latent, unspoken form of thought, into explicit\naudible speech can be said to be spread over three stages, Viz. </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Pashyanti, Madhyama</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">and Vaikhari.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhartrhari explains\nthat Vak or any sort of communication passes through these three stages\nwhenever one speaks or gives expression to it in any other form.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sabda which is\nat first quite internal is gradually externalized for the purpose of\nutterance.&nbsp;Hearing, &nbsp;operates in the reverse direction .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dashinamarthy and the\nfour kumaras&nbsp; (Sanaka, Sanandana,\nSanatana and Sanatkumara) communicated by telepathy through these very subtle\nforms of vak in absolute silence.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/01/lord-shiva-as-first-guru-dakshinamurthy.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/01/lord-shiva-as-first-guru-dakshinamurthy.html</a></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The three forms of\nspeech viz. Pashyanthi, Madhyama and Vaikhari which correspond to intention,\nformulation and expression&nbsp; represent\niccha-shakthi&nbsp; (power of intent or\nwill),&nbsp; jnana-shakthi (power of\nknowledge) and kriya-shakthi (power of action).</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound sprouts in Para\n(supreme) form, it becomes two-leafed (that is first manifested) in Pashyanti\n(radiant) form, buds in the Madhyama (subliminal) form and blooms in Vaikhari\n(acoustic) form; sound thus produced will become unmanifested, when the order\nis reversed.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shabda Brahman is the\nsource of sound and is in the form of sound which is unmanifest, therefore it\nis called Para and appears to express the kinetic part of the static quiescent\neternal reality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The general perception\nis that when we speak, sound comes from the throat. But what happens actually\nis when we have the urge or the thought to speak, our life force in the form of\nvaayu, starts from the root chakra and brings Para, the subtle sound, then\ntravels up<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sabda also has to\npass through several stages before it is fully audible at the gross level.\nThese stages are termed as Paraa, Pasyanti, Madhyamaa and Vaikhari.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each level of sound\ncorresponds to a level of existence, and one's experience of sound depends upon\nthe refinement of one's consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cosmic creative\nvibration ( sphota ) arises between Shiva and Shakti called Nada.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Nada then gets\nconsolidated into Shabda Brahman (differentiated sound energy), the universal\ncosmic resonance, symbolized by OM.&nbsp; From\nthis arises cosmic intelligence that is responsible for the creation.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sphota, before it\nopens, is in an undifferentiated partless state.&nbsp; &nbsp;It\nresides in Sabda Brahman, the Brahman of Sounds. &nbsp;When it differentiates, it falls into two\nparts: Shabda and Artha, Sound and Meaning. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sound exists as Nada&nbsp; in Shabda Brahman and the force that makes it\nblossom is Bindu&nbsp; which is also resident\nin Sabda Brahman.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When there is a\ncombination of breath and energy 'Nada' or musical sound is produced. In other\nwords, when breath is energised it gives rise to musical sound or 'Nada'.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are two types of\nnada: ahata, which is external sound perceived by the body/mind, and anahata,\nwhich is internal sound that is perceived by the heart chakra.</span> <o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ahata' means ' struck'\n( produced ) &nbsp;and. Anahata ' unstruck ' (\nnot produced ).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first is ahata\nnada, which is&nbsp; sound that is produced,\nsound that gives an immediate&nbsp; impact, sound\nof all kinds whether a human being can hear it or not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">External music is\nconveyed to consciousness via the ears, in which mechanical energy is converted\nto electrochemical energy and then transformed in the brain to sensations of\nsound<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">But according to the\nancient wisdom of Indian philosophy there is yet another type of sound which is\nthe source of the first, anahata nada, cosmic sound.&nbsp; This is sound that is potential, thought but\nnot expressed.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This cosmic sound is\nperceptible only to the 12 strand DNA Maharishi -- the unstruck sound which\nvibrates in space without a cause, the sound that is produced from the\nether.&nbsp; &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anahata nada pervades\nthroughout the universe. Maharishis only can hear this nada and they do upasana\nfor the liberation from this world to get moksha.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The anahata nada&nbsp; is also the sound of devotion and\nconcentration, the sound that the yogi hears in deep meditation whose function\nis to liberate the soul.&nbsp; Inner sound is\nsacred and once reached will open the practitioner's chakras, which ultimately\nwill unite the body to the divine.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhartrhari explains the\nrelation between the Sphota and Nada through an analogy of reflection of the\nmoon on the surface of water.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The relation between the object (moon) and its\nimage (reflection) is because of the reflective surface (water). And the\nmovement of the reflection might not necessarily be because of the movement of\nthe object (moon).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He says; just as the reflection on the water might give an\nimpression as though the moon&nbsp; (object)\nis rippling and moving, similarly the Sphota takes on the properties of uttered\nspeech ( sequence, loudness or softness and so on) in which it is manifested.\nAccording to this view, the reflection acquires the qualities of the object.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ninner music owes its reception to the subtle heart chakra, also known as\nanahata chakra, which is not a sensory organ.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sruti of Vedas take us\nto a place without vibrations (Asabda).&nbsp;\nThe Nadi Vibrations induced by some Mantras take us there. (We go from\nSound to Eternal Silence.)</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unmanifested Sound &nbsp;= Avyakta Sabda;&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Manifested Sound &nbsp;= Vyakta Sabd<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">According to\nBhartrhari, the process of transformation of a thought or an impulse arising in\nones consciousness into a cognizable, explicit speech resembles the evolution\nof the Universe from the un-manifest (A-vyakta) to the manifest (Vyakta)\nmaterial world.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The general perception\nof a layman is that when we speak, sound comes from the throat.&nbsp; But what happens is when we have the urge or\nthe thought to speak, our life force in the form of vaayu, starts from the root\nchakra and brings Paraa, the subtle sound, then travels up to the navel, heart\nchakras as Pasyanti and Madhyamaa respectively, then comes to the throat,\nmouth, teeth and tongue as Vaikhari to come out as speech or sound at the gross\nlevel.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These four levels of sound correspond to four states of consciousness. Paraa\nrepresents the transcendental consciousness. Pasyanti represents the\nintellectual consciousness. Madhyamaa represents the mental consciousness. And\nVaikhari represents the physical consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These states of\nconsciousness correspond with the four states known technically as Jagrat,\nSvapna, Sushupti, and Turiya - or the wakeful state, the dreaming state, the\ndreamless state, and the transcendental state.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EraBBFFDt60/W9Rijrskk-I/AAAAAAABeyc/NPtnT1HzxzYqtUEAuu7yT9uI0i6NEmPSACLcBGAs/s1600/omdd-symbolism_1_orig.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"801\" data-original-width=\"870\" height=\"588\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-EraBBFFDt60/W9Rijrskk-I/AAAAAAABeyc/NPtnT1HzxzYqtUEAuu7yT9uI0i6NEmPSACLcBGAs/s640/omdd-symbolism_1_orig.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the cosmic level,\nSphota is the force behind the Word-Logos, the infinite expressing itself\nthrough sound. The entire possibility of the experience of life is mapped in\nthe sound of OM, the pranava, that runs prana or breath&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Mandukya Upanishad\nsubsumes the entire mystery of Brahman into the syllable Aum or Om, the three\nstates of waking, dreaming and deep sleep akin to the three matras of A, U and\nM, the Sphota , the Nada-Shabda Brahmn being the \u201cmaterial of all words\u201d&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM alone can be the generalised symbol of all possible sounds.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sphota refers to that\n\u2018non-differentiated language principle\u2019; and, that later gave rise to the\ntheory of Sabda-advaita (word monism).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the theory of\nlanguage proposed by Sanskrit grammarians the advaita state - Jagrat Sushupti-\ncorresponds to para mode of language acquisition and communication process.\nThis is the purport or experienced meaning state.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This state is a state of\nawareness of experience of meanings. And in this awareness the untransformed\nvirtual mental reflection is the flow of pure experiences. Pasyanti mode of\nlanguage is the state of sense (of words/sentences) or artha sthiti or state of\nverb. The verb will be in a present continuous or infinite form without subject\nand object attached.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When an object energy-form is sensed through inner mental\ntools , this verb state becomes a state of sentence \u2013 feeling or thought. This\nstate is madhyama mode of language -the state of sentence or thought and is the\nmodulated form of virtual mental energy reflection.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This modulated energy- form\ngets transformed into sound energy through vocal chords\u2019 movement and is\nexpressed /uttered. This is the vaikhari mode of language.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Turiya has no limits\nand no endpoint. It is infinitely transcendent, which means its potential is\nforever expanding.&nbsp; You are now a unique\nindividual and you are a vital part of a larger universal life force that\ntranscends everything on earth..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reality and truth\nbecome more clearly defined, allowing you to perceive that which lies above,\nbelow, and beyond the human experience.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This utterly quiet,\npeaceful and blissful state is the ultimate aim of all spiritual activity this\nhighest state is not affected by Maya The Waker, The Dreamer, The Deep Sleeper\nand The Observer. You experience detachment and joy .&nbsp; Turiya Consciousness&nbsp; is the ultimate goal of spirituality for here\nyou know what freedom is all about. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Turiya is regarded as\nsynonymous with videhamukti, liberation without a body A saint is a very\nordinary guy.. A sage is the extraordinary being. A sage does not dream,\nbecause he has no polarity. He\u2019s just a witness. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the four states\nof consciousness, as per Patanjali Yoga.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the waking state\nor jagrat. Beta brain wave<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the dreaming\nstate or svapna.&nbsp; REM sleep state<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">OM is the deep sleep\nstate or sushupti. (dream-less deep sleep state , the delta brain wave)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Om is the\ntranscendental state or turiya. (beyond all the states) , the fourth has been\ncalled nirvana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Four stages:\nconsciousness plus thinking is waking, consciousness minus thinking is turiya,\nunconsciousness plus thinking is dreaming, unconsciousness minus thinking is\nsleep.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We ordinary people lack\ncontact with our fourth state of consciousness, and so we fail to live up to\nour potential as human beings. Turiya yoga emphasizes a complete freedom,\nrejecting force and power, and instead embracing the ideal of a universal\nharmony.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These four stages also\ncorrespond to the four types of bodies. The Sthula sharira, ( physical body)\noperates in the state of Jagrat (wakeful state).&nbsp; It is in this realm of consciousness, and\nthrough this body, that the Vaikhari-vaak is manifested. The Sukshma-sharira, (\nsubtle or psychic body ) operates in the state of Svapna. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is in this realm of\nconsciousness, and through this body, that the Madhyama-vaak is\nmanifested.&nbsp; The Kaarana-sharira, (\ncausal body ) , operates in the state of Sushupti ( deep sleep ).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is in this realm of consciousness, and\nthrough this body, that the Pashyanti-vaak is manifested. The Para-vaak is\nmanifested through the fourth state of consciousness, known as Turiya.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
